description:
Mediterranean crepe was great
Olives were fresh 
Feta cheese was yummy
Potatoes were filling 
Big menu
author: Ahmed K.

description:
GREAT service, good food, comfortable environment - The Crepe House is a wonderful place to grab a bite, work a little and hang out with friends.

I frequently work from The Crepe House (they have free wifi!) and once a week meet my teacher for a Japanese language lesson.  There is lots of space and the tables are nicely spread out, not crowded together as you often find in other places. It's lively enough to prove that plenty of others find the place enjoyable, but rarely too noisy or crowded. My teacher and I never have a problem conducting our lessons here - it's calm enough to focus on listening and conversation.

The best part about coming to The Crepe House is the service provided by CARLA and BRUNA! They are amazing. Always friendly and helpful, they welcome me by name, happily caffeinate me early in the morning when I can barely mumble the words "coffee please" and take a minute to ask how I'm doing while taking my order with a smile.  I've spent time at other cafes and even other crepe-themed spots, but I always come back to The Crepe House now, specifically because Bruna and Carla always make me feel welcome. =)

Food is good, nice selection, reasonably priced and always fast to show up after ordering.  $5 beer on tap too, a temptation I've so far managed to resist, but a good deal and not something I've seen often at other similar places.

If you're looking for a chill place to grab a bite and hang with friends, stop by The Crepe House and say hi to Carla and Bruna - they'll be the lovely ladies who greet you with a smile. =)
author: Eric H.

description: Worst breakfast I've had in a while. My wife and I had Eggs Benedict and Eggs Florentine and it was just gross. Not just no flavor, but bad flavor. The hollandaise sauce was disgusting. The potatoes had no salt whatsoever.
author: David R.

description:
Instead of our weekly Friday office lunch, we had a Tuesday breakfast / brunch to coincided with a company wide meeting of sorts. Our delivery order arrived via Caviar on Tuesday, March 20th around 9:15am.

*Chorizo Scrambled: Onions, cilantro, eggs, and spicy sausage, Three-egg omelets served with rosemary potatoes and English muffin ($11.95)
*Dessert Crepes - Strawberry: Brown sugar and cinnamon and whipped cream ($7.95)

I asked for my scramble to be served with a side salad instead of potatoes which did happen. The scramble was okay. It was kind of lukewarm, but I was starving, so I ate the whole thing. I think it would have melded together better if there were cheese though. I did enjoy the greens. Probably my fav part of the dish. Unfortunately, they gave me toast instead of an english muffin. Kind of disappointing as I was looking forward to that english muffin. The crepes were not good. Too thick. And not sweet enough. I normally don't even like desserts that are too sweet, so I think this definitely needed more sugar.

Overall, a very lackluster breakfast. They actually ended up messing up a few of my coworkers' items as well. I have a feeling we'll probably not be ordering from them again.
author: Elena N.

description:
This is a cute casual neighborhood spot. They have wifi so it's a good spot to stay and work for a bite, or also to grab a bite. 

If I weren't in the neighborhood, I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here. But it's good for a quick tasty bite nearby. They are known for their crepes, but we like the carne asada steak salad - it's pretty interesting as it is carne asada on top of greens and Asian noodles. Tasty!
author: Dorothy T.

description: Yummy! That's my first time to eat professional crape. In my country, there're some sweet ones and which are just loved by young girls. I dropped by for working with co workers via meet up. WiFi and charger is set there, really great! I really really love this crape :)
author: Shun Y.

description:
Had brunch at the Crepe House on Valencia yesterday w/ a friend & was a bit underwhelmed. The day before yesterday I went to the St. Francis Fountain for brunch & they had over a dozen vegan options for brunch there which was pretty stellar.

Yesterday at Crepe House they had two sandwiches that could be made vegan yet felt the tofu scramble was my best bet. The menu said the tofu scramble came w/ tofu, spinach, mushrooms, & onions sautéed w/ spicy peanut sauce served w/ potatoes & choice of toast.

I didn't find the spicy peanut sauce to be spicy or flavorful as any vegan or vegetarian knows tofu is bland to begin with unless you do something w/ it as it absorbs flavor. I felt like there could have been more veggies as well.

Traditionally feel tofu scrambles come crumbled not cubed & are seasoned w/ turmeric to give it a look like scrambled eggs. Of course nutritional yeast & spices are usually added.

I feel this tofu "scramble" was similar to Crepevine on Castro yet preferred the tofu scramble better there. All in all if you are a vegan or vegetarian that ends up here go for the tofu scramble as it is A-OK yet for a more innovative & fun experience check out St. Francis Fountain that does a killer vegan brunch.
author: Shane S.

description: The hidden gem of Valencia street?? Needed a bathroom and a pick me up so I ordered the iced mocha. It was delicious and picture-worthy. The inside was awesome too it felt rustic and was super clean. Free WiFi and outdoor seating puts this place above and beyond! I didn't try any of the food but I have to assume it's also very good because I wasn't even hungry yet everything looked good. Plus the prices were reasonable and the menu was huge! I'd suggest going if you're in the area, definitely an awesome little spot.
author: Cara H.

description: Bugs in your food at Crepe House on Valencia! We ordered take out and found an oversized ant with wings and a lady bug in the salad. We called and the manager refused to reimburse us ... and then hung up on me! Terrible!!
author: Marisa A.

description: Always solid food at reasonable prices. Super accommodating with substitutions. Good for large groups
author: Jessica C.

description: Not sure why this place has such low reviews, I have been twice and LOVED the savory crepes and roasted potatoes!  My favorite is definitely the Miami heat.  The interior is very cute and laid back with nice big windows that open up to the ccsf campus.
author: Jasmine M.

description:
This place was just OK. The atmosphere is really chill with the large wooden tables and walk-up order and take your number style eatery.

I ordered one of the crepes and asked if they could stuff it with cheese and spinach. The other crepe items did not sound very appetizing since they were more plain with little to no stuffing.

The crepe was a bit dry. The coffee was horrible too. Yuck. I took a few sips and just left it on the table. I ate quickly and headed down the street to grab a cup of coffee from a local cafe.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I had lunch here last week.
You can bet it's consistent and the food is terrific. I had the Salmon Salad and the fish was cooked perfect!
Lunch time was full but table turn over was quick and I was able to grab a seat just after ordering.
I'm not sure if the Crepes is a chain but consistent tasting food is important to me since time is a huge factor. Yes I'll visit again and so should you.

Why not FIVE stars? 
The table I sat at had dishes from the previous folks and it took a while for them to clean it up, but it was cleaned before my food arrived!
author: Pstephan A.

description: I made togo order: spaghetti for today's lunch and this hair from food made me lose the appetites....
author: Jessie S.

description:
Service is pretty lame  
Salmon was super duper dry as dry as the service.
Salad came out with JUST LETTUCE
author: Arion P.

description: Visiting San Francisco from Seattle, we stopped in here for brunch. We sat outside, with our 5 month old. My husband ordered the steak tacos, with the SUPER DELICIOUS black bean chili. My sister ordered the apple crepe, and I ordered the eggs Benedict. All of our meals were 5 stars. Clean facilities, and a great ambiance. Glad we stopped in.
author: Kaylah D.

description:
My brother was craving crepes tonight so conveniently, this place was in the area.

I ordered the salmon Cobb salad, substituted with blue cheese with feta and my brother orders the spaghetti dish and the banana foster. 

Food was ready in about 15 minutes. My salad was very good- romaine lettuce, hard boiled egg, bacon, feta, salmon, croutons, onions, carrots, and a delicious lemon olive oil vinaigrette (so fresh and so good!) My brother's dish was a typical spaghetti dish, I had a bite and it didn't stand out to me- typical comfort food. Banana foster was good! Good portion size and came with vanilla ice cream. 

This place is good if you are wanting home-y breakfast!
author: Marcie A.

description:
Ordered Grubhub from this place, and to be completely honest, I don't think The Crepe House could have tried less. There is no question in my mind that it took them focused effort to care as little as they did about our order, because it's not humanly possibly to produce this poor of a product. You need to try to fail to send what they sent us... They did, and they did, lol. 

I stuck a fork in the ice cream that the crepes were supposed to come with in order to illustrate what a mess they presented. The crepes themselves, looked like someone threw a touchdown pass into box. The pictures were taken as received; I just opened the box, said a few curse words as I questioned what I was looking at, and took the pics. 

You suck mega The Crepe House III. You literally care 0 and you made that abundantly clear. By the way, is it "III" because you guys try 3x harder to not give a flying fk about what comes out of your business, or because you suck 3x more than any other place that serves people food? Either way, I'll never be back.
author: Kevin E.

description: Good affordable food in the Mission I had Cesar salad and black beans both were tasty. Will return for a repeat and get something creperie....
author: Paul D.

description: Ordered a mango mojito that looked good but barely had any alcohol. It was probably the person who made it so I won't blame the establishment entirely. Maybe I'll try again another time.
author: Tram H.

description:
If I could review it separately I would give 5 stars for the beautiful decor and very friendly wait staff. 
The food however was so bland, it was tragic. I ordered the Miami Heat which is apparently their most popular item. I asked if they could make it spicier and they did so by adding entire jalapeño peppers which were barely sliced up. The crepe "sandwich" was only lukewarm so it was hard to enjoy once covered in very cold salsa.
Won't be coming again.
author: Caroline E.

description:
Mine and Gerry's go to coffee spot. I always order their Mocha which is almost close to how Rahmi makes them. Gerry orders the Cappuccino, everything here is good or at leart everything that we have tried like the Spaghetti Bolognese, the Banana Foster crepe with vanilla ice cream and the Apple Crisp...the employees are all super nice especially that one time we stayed til Close and til they actually left the restaurant themselves.

Will keep coming back.
author: Em B.

description: My friend and I came here for dinner the other day. She ordered the salmon salad and it only had three small pieces of salmon. I ordered their chicken pesto crepe and my salad was drenched in dressing. The food was mediocre, however we were served quickly. There is a lot of available seating as well.
author: Sandeep C.

description: This is such a great spot to eat and relax and get work done. Love the space inside and outside. There's natural light and air flow. Friendly staff ... very attentive and respectful. I ordered breakfast and a dessert crepe and it was delicious. They even have gluten free crepes with request!
author: Alanna S.

description:
Still a hidden spot to be found.  

Atmosphere: High ceilings, one big television screen, one big community table, plenty of other tables to seat yourself.   It feels very homey.   If SF was my hometown, you'd find me studying here.

The service: the cashier is also the barista and waitress... and she was flowing so well solo, with two cooks spitting out food from the kitchen.

The food: Servings are huge and perfect size for me.   Their breakfast options vary from crepes to pancakes, eggs and toast to benedicts, hot apple cider to Americano's, more and galore.   Their potatoes are flavorful with rosemary.   Their hot apple cider has a cinnamon stick to add a bit of flare.   Their crepes are amazing: banana, Nutella, and ice cream, you can't go wrong.

My friends and I were really happy to stumble into this place for breakfast.   This cute, humble abode is perfect for your gastronomic needs!
author: Roxana N.

description: Awesome place with an amazing extensive menu. We stopped for a drink. We had a Bloody Mary and a beer. It was perfect and really enjoyed having a local IPA. Definitively a good spot to come back next time we are in San Francisco!
author: Hugo d.

description:
This morning was a mess. I woke up and forgot I'd committed to making my daughter breakfast before she had to go to work. She's been working so hard and is going to summer school and I try to help when I can, but today? Oops. 

So I thought I'd order some food and have it delivered to her at work. Amazon Prime to the rescue. I found The Crepe House III on the app, ordered a crepe, a sandwich and some potatoes (that way she has breakfast and lunch and I met the 20.00 delivery minimum.) 

In the special requests field I typed the deletions I thought she'd want from the sandwich; no tomatoes, no sprouts. Totally meant to but forgot to type "no pesto." 

Sat down to do my daily meditation and remembered the omission. OM-Mission. See what I did there? 

Called Amazon customer service and they told me there was nothing they could do to change the order. I asked if I could call the restaurant directly and Amazon told me no, they won't be able to change the order. I imagined my daughter taking a bite of the sandwich and tasting the pesto, which she really cannot eat in any amount (hates cilantro, tastes like soap to her) so I called the restaurant directly, hoping, hoping. 

A very friendly-sounding gentleman answered the phone and informed me that the order was ready to go; when I pleaded with him telling him that my daughter just can't eat pesto, he conceded and to my everlasting relief, agreed to change the order to accommodate us.

Customer service like this makes my day. Thanks The Crepe House III!
author: Liz B.

description:
I just ordered a simple lox bagel, one request: no capers, add sliced cucumbers on an onion bagel.

20 minutes later, I got a burned poppy-seed bagel with capers, extra tomatoes, no onions, sliced cucumbers, and a few tiny shriveled pieces of lox.  I got a glass of water while I was waiting for my order and realized my glass was dirty and runny with some kind of white powder.  

I just wanted a lox bagel and they messed it up. I'm done with this place
author: Mahmud D.

description: Oh my, I love the Crepe House, specially the salads, and the crepes! Just tried, shared with a friend, the Eggplant and Miami heat crepes and they were superb! The Crepe House on Valencia St., is a must place to go in SF! Great restaurant from food to ambience and outdoor seating!
author: Glaucia S.

description:
Nice place to get a dessert crepe at night. Very quick service and the food did not disappoint. I ordered the apple pie crepe? Idk what it was called, but there were all the ingredients for apple pie in it lol. The crepe was not dry and very moist. The apples were sort of fresh but I was a little disappointed that the filling was not as warm as I wanted it to be. The ice cream server on the side was tasty. Overall, I will
Come back for another crepe when I am having a sweet tooth.
author: Ricardo R.

description: The crepes were delicious!! They give you really large portions and the crepes come with potatoes and a salad which was a pleasant surprise. There was ample seating, including outdoor seating, and no line.
author: Pamela F.

description: This place is great! Was walking on streets if Valencia and wanted to grab a pancake. Found this place based on Yelp. I ordered a portion of pancakes with fruits. The pancakes were perfectly made, maple syrup was super tasty, fruits were fresh and topped it with ton of whipped cream. Exactly what I wanted, service was great too. Highly recommemd this place!
author: Spurthi D.

description: Had a very good Bananas Foster crepe here today. Sat out in the sun, food was brought out to us. Service and ordering experience was solid. Can't wait to go back.
author: Daniel B.

description:
I used to like The Crepe House as it is a quiet and cosy place to work and have a coffee some decently priced food.
Unfortunately I got food poisoned by their burger pretty bad... Thus this 1 star review.
author: Alex B.

description: Came here randomly on Saturday with a friend of mine since we were craving dessert. Shockingly for a crepe house it was not busy at all. The place overall is huge, which is a plus. They have a variety of crepe options on their menu. I ordered the strawberry nutella crepe and my friend ordered the mixed crepe. Both were about $7 each so together it was $14, which we thought wasn't bad, but when our food came out the portions were pretty tiny to share. It did come with a bowl of vanilla bean ice cream. The crepe being small made me a little upset because other crepe places are huge. On top of that the strawberries in the nutella were super tiny and sour. We literally ate and left. On the plus side, the service is good. They deliver the food to your table. They have a huge t.v against the wall and they were playing the warriors game which is what we wanted to see. Water is self serve in the front counter. Overall, don't think i'll come back here for crepes anytime soon. It's too far to get to. If you do live the near the area and comfortable with paying more for small crepe by all means give this place a try. Also, street parking can be difficult.
author: Danika P.

description:
My favorite spot at mission area...
Great atmosphere and awesome food ... 
Definitely best Waffle fried chicken in town..
Their staff are very friendly and service is always fast...  Super chill place.. love it!
author: Lais A.

description:
I went here for brunch with friends.  It was the only place in the Mission that didn't have a ridiculously long line.

I ordered Eggs Florentine with potatoes and orange juice.  Pretty standard in price, portion, and flavor.

It's pretty big inside, and they have outdoor seating.  However, there were people with macbooks taking up the tables that were lined against the wall, so finding seating was a bit challenging.
author: Vira P.

description: I am a chicken and waffles fanatic.. I specifically yelped for a chicken and waffles place and this one caught my eye. I have tried many different places for chicken and waffles and this one is pretty up there. They satisfied my cravings and I would love to come back to try other things. The portion is huge and the price is worth it (about $13/14?). The chicken is so juicy and crunchy and the waffle is pretty crispy/soft.. Idk how to explain it but I like it when my waffle is not soggy after putting syrup on it. The place is also really cute, and their menu is really big. There is just so much going on, I want to come back. It is self-serve type of thing where you order first at the counter, and they bring it to you.
author: Katie L.

description:
It's a bit of a hit or miss with this place. Their menu is extensive, ranging from sandwiches to waffles to crepes to salmon LOX bagels, so it's very hard to decide what to get; I wish they would cut it down to a few things they are great at delivering, as opposed to having that many dishes most at mediocre quality. I feel like the chef couldn't decide what to serve, and eventually, sell decided to serve *everything*.

I think the potatoes are tasty, but could use a little more crunch and salt/flavor.

The location is nice, and generally not that long of a wait. Plenty of sitting outside on weekdays.
author: Zorayr K.

description:
Came here for breakfast during our trip in San Francisco and omg it was delicious!!! I had the Miami Heat Crepe and it was great but Bears Chicken & Waffles stole the show! I kept eating from his plate till it was all gone. It was amazing! 

Lots of choices on the menu. The hot chocolate is heaven!

Definitely recommend this place!!
author: Melody K.

description:
This place is cool. The menu board is huge. There is a lot to choose from!! And the place is big and spacious. It kinda has a barn feel to it, in a cool way. 

I couldn't decide what to order because I wasn't very hungry. I ended up getting the buttermilk pancakes. It was plain and simple, but very good. 

I will definitely come back here again. Next time with a bigger appetite.
author: Edie G.

description: Came to try out the hot apple cider that my co workers raved about it. It was disgusting. I'll give this place another shot, but this time I'll be ordering some food to try out. So in the meantime I'll just give this place one star. And ordering took forever since nobody was at the register to take my order.
author: Jessie M.

description: I have never been to this place in person. I've only ordered takeout. But after 3 bad experiences (yes, I'm a slow learner), I thought it was time to write a review. I ordered 3 different meals, and they were all terrible. First, the food is always cold when it gets here, which I realize is a risk of ordering takeout in general. And it always arrives as complete mush, largely because of the type of to go containers they use and the fact that they just throw everything together in one container. Tonight was the worst. My eggs florentine and side of fruit was thrown together and arrived as sort of a banana/kiwi/hollandaise stew with a side of soggy English muffin. I almost puked when I opened the box. Completely inedible. The other two times, I ordered an omelette and the huevos rancheros. Each time was worse than the prior. Will not make this mistake a fourth time.
author: Emily S.

description:
When I spot a TV screen, I get a little worried. But I've come to understand the TV means people want to stay and chill, and that their hosts are happy for them to do so.

I've known this place for a long time, and have had it mentally bookmarked with the subheading 'cheap and breezy.' 

The $5 premixed Bloody is fair. You can't find cheaper! But the quality of food is so variable. Even on one plate, you might find one egg slightly overcooked and the other completely overlooked. Seriously, that second one was dangerous. But what really turned me off was those gritty pink meat circles, and the septic looking hollandaise. They have just sealed it for me: 
It's not worth saving two bucks yet being unable to eat. The level of quality and cleanliness really need to improve before I'd recommend coming here, and with so many competitors, I really hope they step up soon.
author: Andrea F.

description: Ordered through grub hub. Fast delivery times and good service. The chicken pesto sandwich is good (and huge, enough for 2 meals) Also like their pancakes and eggs, but no regular bacon-only ham and Canadian bacon. The chai lattes are pretty darn good as well.
author: Marie W.

description: This place is so meh, especially for the Mission. Got a bagel (with cream cheese, onions, tomatoes, and sprouts) to go before a class I had, thinking it would be really quick to make, but it took them around 15-20 minutes to prepare it. NBD, but that raised my expectations a bit, thinking more time spent on making something meant better quality... but no. It was literally just a kind-of-hard bagel, warmed up minimally, sloppily spread cream cheese, sliced tomatoes, sliced onions, and a bunch of sprouts. Didn't warrant the 15-20 minutes to make it. Tasted very mediocre, too. Something I probably could make for 1/3 of the price at home. Coffee was alright, though... but won't be coming back again.
author: Trisha D.

description:
As my lunch at Paprika was thwarted by incorrect hour data in Yelp, my new mentee and I went to The Crepe House to try out something new for her and me. I walked in and it reminded me of Crepevine. The menu was the same or similar.

As much as I wanted to try the Reuben crepe, I ended up going with a fairly healthier option of the New Orleans which had swiss cheese, chicken breast, sun dried tomatoes, and salsa. 

It took a little time to get the food, but that was ok. We were talking anyways. The food again looked like Crepevines. Homestyle potatoes which were nice and crispy. I love crispy potatoes. There was also a side salad which was a bit more dressed than I like. The crepe was ok nothing mind blowing.

I wasn't super wowed by the place, but if you're wanting a place for crepes or even a variety of other options (salads, sandwiches, breakfast, etc.) then this would a good place to have a laid back lunch.
author: Carolen M.

description: Crepes are huge and delicious! It came with a side salad and breakfast potatoes. Food came out super quickly.
author: Lauren F.

description:
What got me the most excited here was the gluten free crepe option. It totally tasted like a normal crepe (which I haven't had in years!). I had the Miami Heat and it was absolutely delicious. The right amount of food and not feeling like you can't finish the meal because it was too rich or buttery or just too much. Great serving size. 
There wifi here too so I was able to do a meeting over food. Noise level is not too high. 
Coffee is reasonable (not amazing) and they have a big range of teas. 
Definitely coming back to keep my crepe cravings in check :)
author: Van-Anh N.

description:
The place to go for all things carb!

Waffles, toast, crepes, and general comfort food is what this place is known for. The portions are huge, and even though the prices are a bit high (~$15 for a plate with a coffee), the pure quantity of food you get is definitely worth the money.

And so is the food quality--the chicken waffle plate included lots of fruits, which were fresh and plentiful. The fried chicken is made hot and crispy, and the waffle was pretty good as well.

Since this place is right across from UCSF, it usually has a lot of folks sitting in, drinking coffee and using free wifi, which is great because there are lots of seating room inside, as well as outside.


Will probably be my go-to place for chilling-out in the future.
author: Henry L.

description: Just left the crepe house on Valencia had breakfast and was horrified with how expensive it was and how small the portions are. $13.00 for a eggs Benedict that was watery and it was the size of an egg mcmuffin with a scoop of potatoes that tasted really bad. My boyfriend got the corn flake French toast that was very pasty and soggy tasting and was not crunchy at all which is the point of corn flake French toast. I asked the wait staff to give me something else since my order was very dissatisfying and tasted bad and was really small portioned. They refused to give me a different order and weren't very nice about it either. Although they did offer me a side of fruit which was also just as unappealing as every other thing we got served. Thanks for the bad food and even worse service! Won't be spending any money here in the future!!!
author: Francesca D.

description: Soooo good. Randomly stopped in here. They had gluten free crepes too, which was a bonus. I got the chicken one. It was good. The salad and potatoes with it were equally as delicious. Ended up eating the entire plate and not realizing it. Definitely try a crepe here.
author: Katie G.

description:
Lots of seating both in and outdoors. 

Food:
-Gluten free options are available for $.75
-Ordered the Fruity Nutella which is good, make sure kiwis are in season or it can be a bit bitter.
-Jasmine green tea comes in a packet but still good.

Atmosphere:
-Plenty of seating both in and outdoors!
-TV to watch games.
-Free wifi

Bathroom:
-Only one in the back. 

Tip: Accepts credit card
author: Chhaya N.

description: Great service. Great omelettes. No attitudes. Reasonably priced.  Good iced coffee. Seems like in a world of expensive hipster places this one stands out as our local place.
author: Chris P.

description: Easy to order and get a table with a large or small group of friends/family. Food was really good and friendly staff. Clean bathroom and easy meter parking nearby.
author: Peace for U.

description: Just yesterday I went to Crepevine (Market & Castro) and still haven't filled my fix for a crepe, so I came to this cute place. I've always wanted to try it, finally today I did. Mistake! As soon I came in the ambiance felt awesome great, but I go to order the menu is huge and I see the cashier (owner) looking at me very ungraciously. I felt rushed and so I ordered the same thing I ordered yesterday! Omg it was awful the chicken crepe has zero favor the side potatoes tasted old the only good thing was the side salad. Never again. Take your business to crepevine!
author: Karina R.

description: Although a great spot to stop and hang out with a comfortable ambiance and hip surroundings. I was greeted with a smile and the staff was very helpful/accommodating, but the food fell a little flat for me.  I ordered the chicken pesto crepe.  The mixed greens were good and perfectly dressed (lightly) but the actual crepe lacked flavor.  Maybe a second time it will be better?  I plan on giving it another try to see if maybe it was just an off day given it was the holiday.
author: Carmelita B.

description:
Having just visitied my tele-communting husband's office space, we wanted to eat something for lunch. It was just after the 1pm hour and the walk was quite lovely up and down the street, but with the afternoon's heat beginning to build, it was really time to find a place. 

I didn't want Thai (There are so many and I've already eaten my fill), and I didn't want sushi, I wanted to try something new, so we decided on the Crepe house.  Walking in, most of the tables were full, so we took that as a good sign.  The menu boards were above us, and there were a LOT of choices.  The husbeast ordered a Steak Mexican Salad and I ordered a Chicken Pesto Crepe and we thought we'd get a Nutella/Strawberry crepe for dessert. 

The food was delivered quickly, all of it was beautifully plated and steaming hot. The steak salad was large with a generous portion of meat on top. My Crepe came with a side salad and home fries as well.  Both were extraordinarily tasty!  Our dessert crepe came with some of the finest tasting vanilla ice cream we've ever eaten.

Service was fast and friendly, with the lady who took our order being one of the nicest people I've encountered so far on my journey!
author: Dianna B.

description:
The food is just so-so. Gotta be honest about that. But the service is *always* excellent and warm and this is one of the best places in the city to work away from home. Obtaining a seat is easy during the day and their Wifi service is superior to most joints. 

My work buddy and I are always productive here. It's neither excessively loud nor quiet as a library. It's just right insofar as we feel comfortable talking, but not at obnoxious volume levels.

Good spot; awesome people working there. We always feel welcome. Kudos to the friendliness of the Crêpe House staff! :D Though I can't rave about the food, I can and do rave about the service/friendliness/hospitality and that's what keeps us coming back time and again. We just enjoy being there.
author: Maya B.

description: 4 stars: I'm a fan! Great place to get work done or study done. Free and fast wifi. Lots of tables. A couple outlets around the walls. There are not many other places to do work in the area that are open late on weeknights. Thanks, Crepe House.
author: Miguel C.

description:
Boyfriend and I wanted to get a nice dinner before a show in the mission. Every place had an outrageous wait...so I gave in and we went here. 
They had so many options! Sweet/Savory crepes/ salads/ pastas ect. I had a salad, bf had a crepe and it was sooo good! The prices were fair and there was alcohol. They even had trivial pursuit on the tables, which was a fun touch.

I would come back here!
author: Madelon C.

description:
We stumbled upon this place for Sunday brunch. It was a bit deceiving because at first I thought it was Crepevine. Later on I learned from one of the servers that they are not owned by the same people. The menus were just similar because they hired the same artist to draw them.

My bf ordered a salmon fettuccine pasta and I ordered eggs benedict w/ side of house potatoes. We also got a cappuccino, which was delicious! We both agreed that the pasta was definitely the much better dish between the two. It came with a creamy sauce and a generous amount of salmon chunks. The eggs benedict was just ok. I think the hollandaise sauce was a bit heavy and the potatoes were slightly mushy too. I would definitely avoid getting it next time.

Overall, a decent brunch/lunch/dinner spot since the menu is diverse and you can order anything from salads and sandwiches to crepes and omelettes. Prices are pretty good too and portions are large.
author: Sophia H.

description: Ok with all honesty and putting my personal issues with one of the hostess, this place is kind of awful. The ambiance is cool open and comfortable, plus an nice outside eating area. Where this place suffers is the food. Really poor choices for there signature crepes and quality of ingredients doesn't seem to be of top   shelf or even middle. It's more like govt subsidized. ..the staff is pretty cool and most of the time helpful and cheerful. I usually tip really well if the service is good, no attitude unless I give it first, they do more than just drop off my food or hand it to me over the counter that I ordered it from (a bar does not qualify as a counter) so basically if they are polite and worked for that tip$$$$. The food quality here though makes me not want to tip, but that is punishing the waitress & hostess not the owners. Curious of those who go here how much do you usually tip?
author: Peter T.

description: Ok Crepe House. Usually your place and food are pretty good. But I have to stand up for what is completely ridiculous and OVERPRICED. One, you raised all your prices and close earlier...NOT good. Two...with tax..I paid over 10$ for 1 Ceasar Salad. I expected obviously the usual. Romain lettuce, giant croutons, good amount of parmesean cheese. Maybe a little extra garnish, maybe a hard boiled egg cut in half. What I literally recieved was bassically one romain stalk and a sprinkle of in the can parmesean cheese. BIGGEST FUCKING RIP OFF EVER. Sad when the walgreens one block away from you...has a better Ceasar Salad and for half the price.
author: Mr. Potato G.

description: I am not giving it a one because the staff and mimosas were friendly, however the food was horrible, no flavor, the eggs Benedict weren't even fully cooked and neither the potatoes. Definitely not coming back.
author: Suzy R.

description:
This place is okay, but too pricey for the quality. It's convenient and pretty quick so it's an easy option. 

Everyone I was with got different dishes:

The burger was good and I'd say that's a safe option. 
A friend got one of the creamy pasta dishes and it was okay...nothing crazy. 
The crab cake melt was mediocre and they were very skimpy on the crab so I felt like I was eating bread and onions for the most part. 
The chicken and waffles are tasty, but you're basically inhaling a stick of butter. 

Basically, the food is okay, but expensive for what you're getting.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: Nice place. Outlets are everywhere. The crew was friendly. I didn't give a 5 because the table I used has a sauce on the edge and they probably didn't see it. I didn't realize until I was about to leave when I saw the table was a bit dirty. Plates used by the other customers were still there even after they left like 5-10 mins so it kinda looked messy. But it's a nice place to study. Quiet.
author: Kat P.

description: I love the crepes, but not the main meal so much. The waiters are nice and the cashier staff are very kind. They let me have extra whipped cream in my hot cocoa all the time. I would recommend this in particular to children, but also to adults.
author: April P.

description:
Crepe was pretty good but the portion was so small and they filled the plate with salad and potatoes :( A rip off if you ask me. 

But it's a chill place that's a great to go place if you're in the Mission.
author: Karen M.

description: I really like this place! Especially if you're looking for a place to chill and get some work done. They have reliable Wifi, food, coffee, TV (sports), and beer - what more do you need?! I've tried a couple of things on the menu and everything has been spectacular. Really nice spot!
author: Derrick S.

description:
Beer for $2.50? Sold!

But nay, it is not right to drink at 1 in the afternoon. Thankfully, The Crepe House has some solid breakfast items for lunch. I was able to get a full-blown omelette with potatoes and toast for around $8 - a regular steal! Eggs were fluffy and potatoes were crunchy, but the toast was a little too burnt and dry. 

Still, a deal's a deal!
author: Casey S.

description:
I love when I walk into a random restaurant, find out it's 3 stars on yelp, and get 4 stars back. I feel like I just found hidden treasure. 

I was with a group of 10 people. We were originally supposed to go to Beretta across the street, but it was an hour wait, so we walked across the street to Crepe House (no offense Crepe House, you were delicious!). It was fairly empty and had plenty of seating that we pushed together 2 tables so we could eat together. So this place is good for groups!

You order up front and they'll give you a number and bring your food to you. 

I decided to try savory crepes for the first time, getting Chicken pesto (the cashier said it was their most popular dish), and it was good. Inside the wheat flour pancake was chicken, cheese, and tomatoes with pesto sauce. It came with a salad and fried potatoes which were BOMB: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/yc5G1g-Rzl1uMHMJ59IKgg?select=Tg7Pw5RvaZj4u-_9C-Ao-w#o3M4EKl63KMuJAmZMy1JzA

But doesn't it look an omelette? I felt like I just ate an omelette....without the eggs.

The potatoes were especially delicious how they were seasoned and fried to crunchiness. 

OVERALL:

Food: 4 stars
Ambiance: Casual, Chill 
Price: $10 for a savory crepe (big enough that I had to take what I didn't finish home)
Service: 4 stars (Friendly and fast)

i'm glad the group and I were able to find this little treasure where we were able to eat together, get fast and delicious food, in a chill and nice environment with plenty of food to choose from: savory crepe, dessert crepe, omelettes, breakfast, pasta, salads, appetizers.  Did I also mention they open til 11pm, have free wifi, beer/wine ($2.50 pint) and mimosas? :)
author: Raquel Y.

description:
The Crepe House is located right across from the CCSF Mission Campus, so its easily accessible and convenient.

I ordered the chicken pesto crepe which came with a side salad. Both items on my plate were good and the salad made me much too full to finish my crepe. The dessert crepes here look so enticing but no way was there enough room in my stomach to get one.

The Crepe House is a no nonsense kind of restaurant. You order up front then grab a seat and wait for your food to arrive on your table. You go up to the counter to serve yourself water. Outdoor seating is also available.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
5 stars for awesome pancakes here, you can get 2 fluffy pancakes, 2 eggs and meat for $9! They also have fried chicken and waffles, which is on their not so visible "Special's Board". It tasted extremely deep fried but was good and extra crispy.

Minus one star because the lunch food is variable in quality - I've had decent tasting salads (ginormous but nothing special), some teeerrrrible steak tacos (I don't know why on Earth I ordered this whilst in the Mission), and consistently delicious pesto crepes.

I would recommend this spot for drinks (amazing happy hour prices, though drinks are not the highest quality and sometimes are diluted), for bringing your laptop and working here (the wifi code is their phone number and its rarely crowded on weekdays), and for breakfast!
author: Jess C.

description:
Wow this place is awful. All I wanted was an omelet with potatoes. 

The omelet was full of cheese, I almost got sick. The potatoes looked under cooked and old. All for $14.

Do not go here.  I wished I would of taken a picture.
author: Cecilia G.

description:
My Tony raved about this place when I first started visiting SF more as a good brunch spot. They have great drink specials everyday and a good selection of beer and wine. The first time we went, I ordered the Cajun Omelet which was very tasty and T always gets the Asian Steak Salad. 
Last time I went, I tried their special of the Crab Cake Florentine Benedict and it was the phenomenal; best Benedict I have ever had in my life. No Lie.
author: Kelly T.

description:
Really good crepes! But very bad coffee! 
I took the Nutella with fruits and ice cream! Delicious :) 

The place it self is nothing extra and the staff is pretty laid back! 

My gf had coffee with milk in it. And the milk was out of date. But the waiter fixed a new coffee for her right away! So no harm done. But it still tasted like crap!
author: Filip A.

description:
Friends brought us here after church one Sunday afternoon.  There was a line going out the door.  You could tell the restaurant is happening and has a following.

We ordered:

Reuben Sandwich - Loved it.  Nicely put together and a great toasty color from the grill.

Italian Omelette - My wife's order.  She liked it but said "it's nothing to write home about".

The service was noteworthy.  We had a party of about 10.  The place was literally packed to capacity.  And still, all the dishes came out at just about the same time, one after another.  It was amazing how they had that timed. They went out of their way to put our tables together, shift some other guests around to make sure we got to sit together.

I would definitely visit again.  If I do, it'll be hard not to order the Reuben again because it was so good, but I have to say the menu is pretty enticing and has a lot to offer.

Looking forward to my next visit.
author: Darien R.

description:
First time here! 

Nice staff, good food, fair prices. Natural lighting and happy people. 
I shared a table with another party of one to politely make room for larger parties to sit. Not one bad thing to say. Check it out.
author: Koko G.

description:
Yummy crepes and a great spot for breakfast or brunch. The food came out quickly and met expectations. 

The crepes were thin and crisp with ample fresh fillings.
author: Schelly Y.

description:
I didn't love my crepe.

The place is really nice and I'll be coming back for a fresh-air lunch. All staff were really nice.

I'll update if my next crepe is better.  I had the salmon, but I didn't even like the potatoes, I did like the greens though.
author: Maggie J.

description:
There's so many awesome eateries in the Mission, it's hard to compete.  I probably wouldn't have come here if it weren't requested but glad I tried it!

I had the Belgium waffles (Topped with bananas, strawberries and powder sugar, $7.25) and a tall coffee for dinner.  Love breakfast for dinner!  Nothing extra special about it; just tasty and filling.  

The guys behind the counter are charming and make you feel welcome.  They have a pretty extensive menu so I wouldn't mind coming back to try a crepe!
author: Kat C.

description: Came here for my craving of crepes. My sister told me about it so I said hey well let's try it. Menu looked pretty good but quite pricey for the crepes. I ordered a blintz. it's filled with ricotta and A (yes 1) strawberry. it sits on apple sauce and maybe blackberry syrup? For the price it was pretty small and my apple sauce had a bit of oniony flavor. chai latte needed a bit more chai. My food might not have been great but apparently everyone elses was amazing. I guess the best sweet crepe is the strawberry nutella accompanied by two delicious scoops of vanilla ice cream. Not a place where I die to go back to.
author: Maria H.

description: This is my go to neighborhood spot for a quick casual bite. It's consistently quick, tasty, and friendly at a very affordable price point. You can get anything from decadent breakfast to healthy salads depending on your mood. Also, I have to give the staff a shout out for holding onto my expensive sunglasses after accidentally leaving them behind yesterday. Thanks! It's basically a friendly, honest, and unpretentious neighborhood cafe.
author: Dan G.

description: Open. Spacious. 14 tables inside. 9 tables outside on Valencia Street. Quiet music. Friendly service. And crepes!
author: Jodie F.

description:
A new favorite of mine. I usually come around to this place when I'm around Valencia for thrift store scrounging. The interior is nice and relaxing with a great view of the street with those huge windows and outside seating for those rare warm days.

The coffee here is pretty standard compared to other cafes. Breakfast items tend to be a bit above and beyond when it comes to prices of very simple items like eggs and pancakes. 

They have a great assortment of tea that I should point out if you're ever in a mood for a cup. I haven't been able to try and crepe, but considering this place close fairly late, it's going to be in the best future.
author: George Z.

description:
Ordered the pesto chicken togo and found a bug on my potatoes.

Umm no thanks.. I won't be coming back
author: Mitu A.

description: This is a decent place with good food. I was seated promptly and my food arrived quicker than I thought it would. I recommend that anyone who likes crepes should check out this place.
author: Letter W.

description:
My girlfriend and I came here for her birthday brunch, and since this was her usual go-to crepe place.. my first time here at The Crepe House was just okay. 

There's outdoor seating just in case you bring your pet, like we did.. or even just to enjoy the street scenery/weather.

I ordered a Miami Heat and she ordered herself chicken and waffles with a side of fresh fruits. 

It was.... okay. Everything here was just okay.

Nothing horrible, nothing spectacular.. just okay.
author: Malinda K.

description: Love this place. The Chicken Pesto crepe is my favorite.  A large menu of items to choose from.  Located in a great neighborhood with good coffee shops as well.
author: Vance A.

description:
Love The Crepe House! I'm always amazed with Fadi's great customer service. Every time I come in here he remembers my name and is very helpful. The place is very casual, spacious, with many tables inside and outside, relaxing music like spanish guitar, fast wi-fi, quick service, and reasonable prices. 

I recommend if you come for breakfast to have the breakfast crepe, for lunch/linner, try the chicken pesto (add avocado) or the pesto - very tasty! If you are in the mood for dessert, definitely go for the nutella with strawberry crepe. Who doesn't love nutella? They all range from $6-$9. If you don't like crepes, they have  breakfast options, salads, sandwiches, bagels, and hot meals. The portions are big and will leave you satisfied. 

We all know Valencia is full of restaurants, but if you are looking for something fast and good in a warm and friendly environment, this is your place!
author: Stephanie M.

description: These crepes are a great choice for brunch! Pretty filling, and comes with sides of salads and potatoes too.
author: Bai L.

description:
Finally got out to the Mision to try this place. Short little line coming out of the cozy cool place. Great look and feel with the typcail chalk board menu high up top we have come to see with crepe offering menus. 

Ordered a mimosa and chicken Pesto crepe. Wifey got the chai and French Toast. added a side of Bacon or good measure at a reasonable total price. 

The wait time wasnt that long from standing in line to recieving the food. Maybe 30 minutes at max. Seat your self after ordering, and pour your own water. The bacon was superb! The chicken pesto dishwas great and the potatoes were ok. Ive been to a few spot with the exact same salad,potato,crepe offering and i wanted more crunch!!

The french toast was great with a splash of corn flakes added into the egg coat. Not bad not bad.
author: Benjamin B.

description: Bananas Foster Crepe was fantastic. The ambience of the building, with its brick wall and wooden ceiling, made for a pleasant eating experience. Glad they stayed open for a few extra minutes to let us in. :)
author: Mark S.

description: Came here all the time when I lived in the Mission last summer. The outdoor seating is excellent on a beautiful, sunny day. Great for people watching or reading a book. The people at the counter are friendly. The OJ is fresh. Mimosas are great. I usually got the pesto crepe which was great, and I got the Belgian waffle once which was pretty good too. Can't wait to go back.
author: Kirstie B.

description:
Surprisingly, good spaghetti with meat sauce! Came here for a late lunch and Zaytoon next door was too busy to serve up an order (clerk counting cash) and popped into the restaurant next door. 

Was highly skeptical since it is a crepe place and generally don't give a shit about crepes. 

Tried the small (kid's size) spaghetti with meat sauce and was pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere with the open windows and spacious seating were definitely a plus. 

Will def be back: chill staff, free wifi, and expansive menu are a good draw and close to my gym.

Thanks!
author: Grace C.

description: Love the food and the drinks great place to hangout the hot coco is great keeps you warm outside in the city when it's cold plus the food is amazing taste so good
author: Victor S.

description:
This place is pretty lame, but I end up here because I walk by it on the way home from work everyday and usually end up being pulled in by the enormous TV and whatever game is on.

The giant TV provides a great view, but the volume is usually super low and there tends to be a general lack of excitement in the air.

Food? Very mediocre. It would be silly to eat here given the amount of good food in the area. I had a reuben last time that wasn't offensive or worth the $10 I paid for it. The fries are good.

The workers are nice but they also seem really sketchy and engaged in "other dealings". 

Beers are cheap enough, but if you're getting just a beer you'll have to pay cash ($8 minimum I believe), and then you'll have a ton of change in your pocket because the round beer price doesn't include tax. That change is sitting in my pocket with their 3rd star.
author: Marcus C.

description: The crepe house is the only and only crepe stop in the mission. I had the pesto chicken sandwich with the fresh salad. Everything tasted amazing and on point. When it gets down to the dessert, the crepes are amazing especially strawberry Nutella. Btw ask for FADI and he will hook you up.
author: Shadi K.

description: The crepe house III has a self explanatory name and features a crepe centered menu. With a beautiful brick and reclaimed wood design featuring a high ceiling and iron chandeliers, the atmosphere is rustic to be sure. The plain dessert crepes cooked succulently with butter and topped with powdered sugar and vanilla ice with strawberries inside was a real treat and was both generously portioned and fairly priced. The only complaint I have is that on the outdoor menu the plain crepes are shown to be served with Ice Cream or whipped cream, however I was offered neither. I had to complain about the ice creams absence before it was happily provided by the polite staff. The fact that it was not initially offered is an indicator to me that they sometimes cut corners, and was not appreciated.
author: Gabriel C.

description:
On the third day of our trip to SF this is by far the best food we've had. We had the Hawaiian Crepe, the Salmon Crepe, & a Strawberry Desert Crepe. All were amazing. I especially loved the real fresh squeezed OJ and freshly made hot apple cider, it made the meal that much more enjoyable & delicious. 

Defiantly going to be a place we return to next time we come to SF.
author: Adrian B.

description: Came for a salad on a Sunday evening and ordered the Asian chicken salad. The ingredients were fresh and veggies had good crunch, but overall the dish lacked any serious flavor punch. Asian-style peanuts were essentially nonexistent. Alright for your basic lettuce, carrots, grilled chicken option, but only in a pinch. I much prefer Grove.
author: Madison S.

description: Amazing! I have no idea why this place would have less than four stars my sis and I came and had eggs Benedict florentine and fruit crepe and coffee. Everything was above amazing and well priced! Even the coffee was very good. The interior of this place is breath taking alone. I highly recommend
author: Jackie W.

description: Basic breakfast place to dine in nothing special if you are looking for something more fancy this isn't the place for you ..,fair prices,good atmosphere great coffee
author: John U.

description:
Came here for Sunday Brunch with my BFF. It was very crowded. Ordered typical breakfast, omlette potatoes and sausage. Actually it was really tasty. Good portion.

Even their coffee was good. Service pretfy quick. 

Parking was a pain. But definitely would come back. Friendly staff.
author: Janet T.

description: First time here won't be the last. Delicious food (try the corn flake French toast- amazing!) also has the Hawaiian crepe, equally tasty. The service was fast and the whole place had a great vibe. A must try!
author: Steve R.

description:
The Crepe House on Polk street is always busy. Now that I live in the Mission, it was time to try the one on Valencia. First of all, this location is twice the size of the Polk St. location. There are more tables outside for you to enjoy your crepes in the sun (bonus star). 

The Nutella, Strawberry crepe was exactly what I was expecting. Sweet deliciousness. My stomach was full afterwords, but not overly stuffed. It comes with you choice of ice cream or whipped cream. 

One suggestion I have for the Crepe House, invest in some better coffee (minus one star)! The coffee was so un-flavorful and bland. Not a good combination with the delicacies of French cuisine..step it up a notch. Oh, and the tables (outside) are extremely unstable. When you cut your food, the coffee will splash everywhere. Be aware of that and cut sloooowwwly.

A nice place to have brunch on a Sunday morning.
author: Jaylena P.

description:
I've been on a crepe hype lately. Their colorful chalkboards and intriguing brunch options call out to me. My frugal self thinks, "You're better off cooking breakfast and saving your money. Remember what your father taught you!" But then the other side of me is like, "Do you really feel like cooking AND washing dishes? On a SUNDAY?! Come on. They have Corn Flake French Toooasssst!!"

OKAY. OKAY. Well if you're gonna twist my arm. 

The hubs and I ordered...
- Corn flake French toast w/ fruit and powdered sugar. Two of my favorite breakfast foods merged into one. I haven't been this excited since I discovered bacon waffles at Christie's in Burlingame!
- Belgian waffle topped w/ fresh fruit
- Crab cake eggs florentine. Because I'm hella fancy like that.
- We drank coffee out of their mismatched coffee mugs :)

Bonus points for our food coming out so FAST. There's lots of outdoor seating so I'd love to come back on a warm day.
author: Mariela D.

description: I ordered a club sandwich with fries another order of fries and two lemonades through uber eats the food was received on time but they got my order wrong and my fries that came with the sandwich was not cooked throughly I called them and told them I spoke to Salan he would not gve me his last name when I asked to speak to. Manager he claimed he wasn't there n didn't kno wat time he was comin in he suggested that I Order another order of fries through uber eats
author: Ajalon W.

description:
Just get the Sopranos crepe, why don't you?!  Filled with gooey mozzarella cheese, crumbled sausage, olives, onion.  Skip the Western crepe..remniscent of Dennys omelette as the filling..- take that statement any way you'd like.  

Size is moderate.  If you're an adult, don't listen to someone's review here when that person noted one crepe is enough to feed 2.  IT IS NOT but you may be full after 3/4.  Crepes come with side salad of mixed greens and finely chopped romaine lettuce and nicely crisped potatoes with no spices.  

Nice interior, Outdoor seating option.  Fairly quick service where you order first, get a number, then they'll bring you your food.  Around $9 for crepes.  Their board of daily specials are around $10-$12.
author: Kimberly C.

description: My cousin and I came here yesterday for a pit stop during our shopping excursion and I must say this is an awesome place! With such a vast menu and upbeat friendly employees, this Crepe House has em all beat! We ordered a chai latte and a Miami Heat crepe. The chai was the best I've ever had. Spicy and a bit sweet. And the crepes were great! I kind of wish I order the pesto crepe but I changed my mind last minute. Miami Heat was just as good as I imagined the others would have been. Excellent food. Cool interior. And the guys helping us were so sweet! I definitely recommend this place if you're spending the day around Valencia!
author: Kirsten S.

description:
By far the best crepe restaurant I have been too. Me and my girlfriend came here for dinner one Friday night, and surprisingly, there wasn't a lot of people (besides another couple in the restaurant, we were the only customers). 

One of the workers, who I assume was the manager, was extremely kind and recommended us some delicious crepes on the menu. I ordered a crepe, while my girlfriend had a French toast. Both were really good. He even gave us a hot chocolate on the house.

According the manager, the table me and my girlfriend sat at was the table him and his wife first met each other. I don't know if it is a sign, but I'm hoping for the best.

Overall, the experience at Crepe House was great. I will be a continuing customer here when I'm in the area.
author: Ej P.

description: Our first choices on a Monday were closed,  and leaving my phone at home on purpose we relied on the check it out from the street method. Are people looking happy, does their food look good if you can catch a peak? C'mon you do it too! Giant colorful menu board drew us in.  Too many choices in wide ranging catagories is scary for quality very often. We had savory crepes, neither the best or worst we've  ever had,  but fresh enough and somewhat tasty. Potatoes on the side were ...again just "ok".  Kinda plain style so as not to over do it for the average eater. So not a cutting edge place, but worth the $ for what you get.  Order at counter, then delivered to your table kinda joint, which often means smaller tip for lower service/care expectations. Staff was nice,  friendly and asked how things were at the end! Nothing flashy but seems like a decent local place for the $, from what we had and others around us. Big TV, but thankfully no sound. Small bar with weird placement, low beer $3.25 prices. Place filled up 70%-80% capacity at this time 2030 on a Monday,  I would say they have plenty of regulars. So-not awesome, but good enough for a meal of decent quality/favor. Place looked clean throughout.
author: Pete M.

description:
We went to brunch here 'round noon today. First thing I noticed was that the band Air was playing on the stereo -- it ended up having at least three of their songs played. Either was a very good Pandora set, or perhaps just an actual decent set of MP3s.

I ordered their Strawberry Nutella Crepe (with ice cream!), plus a mocha. Very healthy, I know. Served promptly. Some "mornings", you just need to wake up.

Will be back for omelettes with chorizo!
author: Garett T.

description:
I have a tough time giving this place more than 2 stars.  I've been twice now (the first time wasn't memorable, I think I was just happy sitting outside - I ate some sort of omelette that honestly tasted like it was made in the galley of an airplane) and yesterday's experience less than stellar.  I got their Chicken Sandwich, which came out to be about $11 with tax, but there really isn't anything substantial on the sandwich itself - just a very small piece of chicken, cheese, peppers, tomatoes and lettuce.  Nothing that warrants $11 - I'd understand that price if it came w/ avocado or bacon (which would actually make the sandwich much better).  The only saving grace is the fact that their beers on tap are $3.75, which is a decent price for the surprisingly good selection of tap beers (nothing extraordinary, but surprising for a crepe place).  

All in all, I think what bugs me the most about this place is the fact that the menu type font/coloring is the EXACT same as Crepevine's and Crepevine is 10x better.  The staff here is nice though, so that's at least a positive.
author: Keith P.

description:
Cute location, cute menu (overwhelmingly long, but full of options), easy to get to, and plenty of seating. 

The food came out in decent time, and I had the blueberry pancakes - HUGE with a TON of blueberries, who can be mad at that? I couldn't finish my plate, but for the price, I wasn't concerned. 

If you are looking for a local yet cutesy hipster place for breakfast or lunch, this is a great spot. It also doesn't hurt that the staff is friendly and patient while you are trying to pick what you want to order!
author: Katie K.

description: Pretty diverse breakfast/lunch menu so the name Crepe House is misleading. But they do have excellent gluten free crepes that actually taste like real crepes so that is a huge bonus in my book. Generous portions, good quality solid food and fast service.
author: Andrea C.

description:
Cute, cute, cute. 

Crepe house, you are cute with your rustic interior and open spaces.

If you come here get crepes! Otherwise, you will probably be unhappy with your order, it IS the crepe house after all. Nice and fairly quiet place to grab breakfast, lunch or dinner. 

I like to come here when I want to get away from all the crazy, trendy, ultra hipster joints with lines around the block. 

Honestly chill spot with local and warm vibes.
author: Stephie M.

description: Sometimes speed and convenience tastes like a unsatisfying, soggy breakfast crepe.
author: Amy C.

description: Good food, tastes fresh, made quickly and friendly staff. Lots of seating and they will bring you your food if you are at the outside seating. I like the chili omelette with the potatoes. This place deserves a solid 4 or 4.5 stars rather than the 3.5 it currently has.
author: Marc R.

description:
First time here! I had the cornflake French toast. It was perfect! The fruit was super fresh. The toast had a delightful crunch from the corn flakes. I'm super happy with my meal. Also, the staff are really nice. 

If you don't want to wait an hour for a table at Boogaloos, walk half a block further to Crepe House. You'll be happy that you did. I'll definitely be back.
author: Rikki J.

description:
There are many things I love about the Crepe House.  Good prices, friendly service, family friendly, not trendy, and solid food.

Given its location, it's one of the few brunch spots that is not trendy, but delivers solid breakfast, brunch, and lunch.  Order at the counter and sit in the inside dining area with plenty of seating options - large windows bringing in tons of natural light and opportunities to people watch.  There  is also a parklet directly in front where you can enjoy the sun (and cars), however this parklet is for public use and not limited to Crepe House.  

Beers are surprisingly cheap at around $3 and up.  Prices and options are comparable to other crepe restaurants - omelettes, creeps, salads, sandwiches, etc. There is a kids menu which is welcoming to families with kids.  Also has a good selections of teas (Mighty Leaf) for you non coffee drinkers.

Lastly there is wifi.  I come here often and don't find myself competing for space to set up an iPad or laptop. Plenty of outlets also available.  

Note: the a elevated bar table near the entrance has Trivial Pursuit games for public use.
author: Adrian N.

description:
Solid eating choice in the Mission. I often come here after playing tennis at some of the nearby courts because of the fast service and good portions. They also have a lovely eating area outside which is great for people watching, and even better when it is sunny! 

They also got a huge TV for the world cup and with the $2.95 draught beers and free wifi, this place is perfect for watching day time games!

The food is solid---doesn't WOW me but is very consistent, hearty, and good. I usually get an omelette or the salmon sandwich. I'm usually a trendy restaurant goer in the Mission, and this place is not trendy. But still a great place to go! Also great for groups. 

The staff is very nice and you can tell it's a family run place!
author: Sarah D.

description: Very disappointing. I used to go here almost on a monthly base, and I brought my friends here for the first time. The strawberry Nutella crepe, is smaller than before. Not just that it was super liquidy, barely any Nutella, oh and the strawberries came out like it was from a paste of jam that we use for pb&j. They are doing very good for business, but that doesn't mean their food quality should go lower. I'm sorry but I won't be coming back.
author: Usama S.

description:
I love this place! I probably come here once a week. The prices are on the higher side, but the service is great every time, and the food is consistent. It's also just a two minute stroll from my place.

The atmosphere is great. It's roomy, with high ceilings and windows, and not pretentious at all. Great place to chill with some food or dessert. They also have free wifi, and usually there's no problem finding a seat.

 I wish the crepes were crispier, but they're still decent. Honestly, Nutella saves everything. I usually come here for breakfast or dessert. I used to get the granola and yogurt with fruit, but not since they changed the granola to resemble dry rolled oats... I don't understand the point of granola that isn't crunchy. But I've also gotten waffles, pancakes, salmon fettuccine, and a variety of drinks here, and it's all satisfied me.  They have a huge menu so there's something for everyone.

If you're in the neighborhood - stop on by!
author: Rebekah H.

description:
Third try for dessert on a Sunday evening.  First two places lamed out and said they were closed (even though according to posted hours they were not.)  It was 9:45. Late yeah, 15 minutes to close.  We were  just going to have a cookie or something at this point.  Nope, the register is closed they say.  

What is this?? An epidemic?  Yes.  A 'we want to close early' epidemic.
People, if you close at 10, then you close at 10!!! I worked in restaurants for YEARS and we never ever pulled this b.s. You want to close at 9:30?  Ok fine, but change your posted hours !!!!
author: El B.

description:
Do not get the eggs Benedict - the Hollandaise tastes like it was made from a packet. Gritty and unpleasant. I was very disappointed.
All of the folks who were eating with me seemed pleased with their meals and it was reasonably priced. If I return, I will stick to a crepe.
author: Kristin T.

description:
Not to shabby.  My friend had suggested to eat here for lunch.  This was my first time ever eating a crepe as a lunch.  I got the veggie pesto crepe.  It came with some salad and potatoes.  Everything tasted really good.  The hardest part was stopping myself from eating the whole plate.  There was a lot of food.  Price for my meal was about $7.95.

I really enjoyed the decor of the restaurant.  It has a lodge feel to it.  Outside you can eat on the extended street patio.  The crepe house has now opened a new door for me food wise.
author: Michelle M.

description: Nice little crepe house, similar to all the others in the city. Omelette was decent and the house fries good. Really liked the smoked bacon on the clubhouse sandwich. Nice little outdoor patio area for those sunny sf days.
author: Dom L.

description:
Sunday brunch in SF might be a production for some (with the hour-long waits and often hurried service). After pacing through the Mission and narrowly avoiding the stand-in-line routine, we happened upon Crepe House. It was busy but manageable- people were enjoying the outdoor tables and mimosas were flowing. Plus, the eggs looked and the french toast wins for what pulled me inside. 

It's a casual, order-at-the-counter operation and once the corn flake crusted french toast and huevos rancheros (plus Pacifico draft and mimosa) were in queue, we took a stool seat by the open window. Our items arrived speedily and let our plates just as quickly. If you're in the mood to extend your brunch, this might not be the place, but if you're in it for the sake of something quick and savory, the Crepe House awaits.
author: Monica S.

description:
Quiet and cute atmosphere. Great if you want to get work done, so bring your electronics because there are plenty of outlets! 

I would have give this place 3 starts since the food was average, but I gave it 4 for the service. Fazzy (I think) was supeeeeer nice, he was chatting it up with my friend & every now and then and kept checking up on us to see if we needed anything. 

Overall, if you like crepes, you'll like The Crepe House.
author: Anusha B.

description: I've been here twice. The first time was okay. The place looks real nice, there's a huge menu board, and outdoor seating. The crepes I ate are something I could've easily made at home. The second time was horrible. I told my friends about how it was such a nice place and that the food was alright. We walked in and all the tables were either occupied or had plates of leftovers from people that had just finished up. After ordering our food we scooted a table together since all the tables that fit 6 people had plates and trash on them and nobody seemed to be doing anything about it. The place wasn't even busy or anything, the lack of clean tables was just ignored. I dropped a bottle of Tapatio (totally my fault) while moving the table and it broke. The guy who took our order lost it. He walked up to our table and started cussing under his breath and continuously shook his head while staring at the floor. I tried apologizing and he just ignored me. He didn't let me help him clean the mess I made which I just understood as him trying to do his job but he just picked up the glass and left all the hot sauce on the floor. My friends could tell I was very upset, but reminded me that it was just a $3 bottle of Tapatio. When our orders were ready he pretty much just threw them on our table and ignored all of our "thank you"s. Again, the food wasn't anything special.
author: Oscar T.

description:
Call me crazy, but I am 25 and coming here a few months ago was the first time I ever tried a Crepe. It was scrumptious. 
The outdoor seating is nice for a summer day or evening. Cute lighting, seating, etc. 
Beef prices are cheap, they give you a large amount of food, and today I found out that their cappuccino (double shot) is perfect.  
This is a great place to stop and grab a bite to eat.
author: Linnea H.

description:
I used to always come here for their hot cocoa and white chocolate macadamia nut cookies in the morning when attending city college (healthy breakfast ftw- ha!) 

It was very convenient to find a little cafe literally right across the street from my school since my classes were at 8am and nothing opened till 10am. 

This was years ago but I'm pretty sure they are still amazing to this day. Ccsf students, come here for breakfast and coffee!
author: Sadia B.

description:
i find it rather difficult to fuck up a crepe, but what the hell do i know about crepes?

the chicken pesto crepe hit the spot.  it was 10 am, and i was still drunk.  the open windows and fresh food = perfect for an impending hangover.  soon after my friend and i sat down, creme house got crowded as shit, and peeps had difficulty finding spots to sit.

probably wouldn't come all the way out here to have crepes, but if you're in the neighborhood, it's a safe bet!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Pretty good!

I really enjoyed their homemade house potatoes, yummy!

Ordered the miami heat which is 2 crepes stuffed with chicken, avocado, chedar cheese onions. It was good but i love a lot more heat! 

I would go back to try their breakfast.
author: Evangelina B.

description: The plate was full! Large crepes for a large appetite, fresh greens and hot potatoes.
author: Dan M.

description:
I live around the corner and have been going to Crepe House for five years now. This is the first time Ive had an issue with them but its inexcusable and dangerous. 
       I ordered two cobb salads, one with feta cheese instead of the bleu cheese it comes with. I explained on the phone that I was allergic. As i get to the restaurant to pick up my to-go salads, Im assuming the delivery driver greets me. I told him hi and i had a to-go order. He told me it would just be a minute, as they put bleu cheese on my salad and had to scrape it off. He laughed as he said this. I then told him I was allergic and asked if they had switched out the lettuce at least, and he said no. I then told him I could just pay for the one salad that was made properly but i couldent wait for them to make a whole new salad. Another man behind the counter assured me it would only be "one minute" until the new salad was made. I told him i really dident have time but he insisted. So i paid for both salads and finally received them. There was no feta cheese on the second salad, no cutlery or napkins. 
       I was unable to attempt to eat my salad until today. I opened it up and guess what i found? Bleu cheese. So the guy behind the counter completely lied to me, telling me they were making me a new salad. I was late to work because this man told me to wait for a salad that i still cant eat. Im so over this restaurant. I cannot trust an establishment that, after i made it very clear TWICE that i was allergic, they still served me food that could put me in the hospital. Pretty shitty way to run a business Crepe House. I will make sure to tell everyone in my neighborhood and everyone I know not to dine here.
author: Brooke P.

description:
Two words: Crab Bennedict! I had an unexpected amazing brunch here, sitting under the sun, drinking a mimosa on one of those days it's sunny only in the Mission.
The people that work there are really nice. I keep going back because I feel so welcome -- and I love their brunch menu. Their crepes are delicious, too.
author: Feliz L.

description:
It's Thursday, sunny day out and I randomly decided to stop in at crepe house. Looks nice enough. I ordered the fruit crepe with banana, strawberry and kiwi. 

It looked like the fruits were left outside overnight. It tasted worst. Thank the universe for whip cream. I left most of the fruit back though. 

Enough said. Hope you have better look than I did if you risk it.
author: Damian M.

description:
Always a sucker for crepes in the morning, and the Crepe House has been good to me over the years, satisfying my craving for thin, French delicacies. What I really enjoy most about this place besides the food is the local vibe. Hip, without trying to be.  This place is what I think about when I think San Francisco flavor. Not the tourist spots. This place, in this neck of the City.

The Mission has always been one of the funkier places to be in, and a delightful mix of different elements and people that populate the Crepe House. Having a crepe place here that serves a pretty decent variation on veggie and sweet crepes is one of the reasons why I keep coming back.

And the service is pretty decent. Even when it's been packed, I haven't had to wait too long to get some food in my maw. And the staff seems to genuinely like working here. (always a plus).

The mixed greens have always been fresh on many of the tasty crepes I have enjoyed here, in particular the Eggplant crepe, with a very good Mozzarella and sun dried tomato combination that I had during my brunch this weekend. I first fell in love with this mix of flavors here before I had that at museums, fancy parties and in dipping sauces from upper-end supermarkets. Always imitated, never duplicated.

*le sigh*

And the Banana Fosters... oh, how my mouth loves you and my thighs hate you, with my tummy torn between the two passions.

Now, for the Salsa crepe... that had more spicy kick than actual flavor to go down with it,  as the black olive and sour creme combination on a crepe seemed excessive. I know, taste is in the mouth of the beholder, but this is my review and my two cents. The combo goes better on a tortilla....

Is it worth the effort to come from one of the City to the other just to try these? 
Honestly, No, but if you are in the neighborhood and have that unusual craving, then by all means sit on in and take in the vibe. 

*Come in early, because as the sunlight gets darker the patrons become... *stranger*.
author: Sonya R.

description: CORN FLAKE FRENCH TOAST & Chicken waffle are bucket list items that must be experienced. Everything else is just as good.
author: Dhar J.

description:
Came here for brunch with a large group on a sunday morning and instantly found a table (which is really rare in the city!) I shared the pesto crepe and a strawberry/nutella crepe with a friend. The pesto was excellent (mozzarella, avocado, spinach, pesto, feta, and tomato!) It came with potatoes and a salad which were sort of average compared to the crepe. The dessert crepe was pretty standard but anything with nutella is an instant crowd pleaser. 

The place is good for a group because you order in the front and then the food is brought to your table. Makes it easier than having to split a large brunch bill at the end of a meal. Also, the trivial pursuit cards on all the tables were awesome :) so much fun to play while you eat!!
author: Vinitha R.

description: I had the chicken pesto crepe and the nutella berry crepe and holy smokes it was absolutely delicious!!! I craved it the whole next day!
author: Claudia P.

description: Cozy! That is how I would describe this place. I have been wanting to come here and finally I have since I was in the neighborhood. It was definitely worth the trip and time. The service was great the cashier was very patient with us and did not rush our order especially the hot chocolates he made. I must say the chicken and waffle plate was worth the price because you are given half a chicken on top of the waffle. The gravy that was put on the side was the cherry on top for the chicken.
