The waffle was good as well it was not dry nor hard. The Canadian Bacon was pretty good and as well the bacon. My girlfriend enjoyed her food as well but I forgot what she had so I can not comment for her however, she did enjoy the omelette she had since she was craving it. All and all it's a perfect place to have a date or have a nice brunch. My next thing on the list is to try the crepes.
author: David U.

description: A solid easy place to grab a bite and linger. Food's pretty decent, but it fills the "diner" gap in the neighborhood. Wish they were open later.
author: Andrew K.

description: Today's experience at the Crepe's House was bad, disrespectful. When I asked if they could please open one of their windows, a young  gentleman replied " I should be charging you $5.00" and went on to open it with a not so friendly attitude. That's what you get at this  place.
author: Nakari R.

description:
Service: 4/5
Food: 5/5
Wait: 3/5
Price: $$
Presentation of food: 4.5/5
Presentation of restaurant: 4/5
Overall: 5/5

I had their Warm Chicken Salad and i was in LOVE! Their sandwiches are great too! I still have yet tried their crepes but I will for sure be back! :)
author: Eva H.

description:
I came here expecting this would be outside my culinary horizon (who eats crepes for lunch?) but was surprised by the selection. I went with a chorizo sandwich (a great spicy option) but what really surprised me was the option of side dishes: fries, salad or potato bits. I've had too many fries in the upcoming days so I was glad to see that this place offered some variety. I went with the potato bits but don't be fooled by the salad: there's copious amounts of it. 

Besides the food, the atmosphere was great for a saturday brunch: open windows, spacious interior and self-serve style. Coming back here!
author: Dmitri S.

description:
Beautiful weather + Carnival Sunday = Too many people in the Mission.

With 4 dozen of Anthony's Cookies (ready my review), the boyfriend & I wanted desperately to avoid the crowds both on & off the streets.  As we walked passed open windows & saw open seats, the 2 of us ducked in without hesitation.  In fact, we didn't even know the name of the place until after we had placed our orders.

He got a Belgian waffle which was fluffy & was topped with lots of fruits.  However, it was not hot enough & the waffle did not have much flavor when eaten "au naturel."  I got Eggs Florentine with sauce on the side.  The eggs were nicely poached & the side of fruits were good.

One thing that irked me was that towards the end of our meal, one of the servers came & asked us to move to a smaller table so a party of 4 could take over our seats.  This was just weird since (1) we were minutes from leaving & (2) this place is supposed to be "seat yourself."

Overall we had a good time & the food was decent.  The weird table switching could very well be a one time thing.  There are many more eateries in the Mission that I haven't tried yet so...until next time...whenever that may be.
author: Karen S.

description:
I love this place.  The room is beautiful, with lots of seating options for groups, couples or singles. The front windows are tall and light the room so beautifully.  The menu is varied, with something for every palate and the food is tasty.    You can't beat the $3 beer in the afternoon and evening either.  So why the two stars?

It's the male members of the staff at this location.  I sat down tonight with my computer, looking forward to catching up on the news, email, etc, while I had a beer and some dinner.  I repeatedly got "connected, no internet access"When  I brought it to the attention of the gentleman who was delivering food and busing tables, he told me,with a blank stare, that he wasn't having any problem with the internet.  When the gentleman sitting next to me said "yeah, she's right", he THEN went and restarted the router.  

I think that this guy had a problem with a woman telling him something wasn't working such that he would have to take some action.  Not an acceptable way to respond to any customer and it is not the way I expect to be treated.  

Probably won't be back.  A pity cause I do like the place.
author: Unemployed D.

description: Randomly found this place on Yelp and decided to come here today. I ordered the chicken pesto crepe and the Belgian waffle. Waited about 10-15 minutes for my food. IT WAS SOOO DELICIOUS!! I finished every bite and left the place with a full, satisfied, happy tummy. You will leave this place with a SMILE on your face :) seriously. I have to come back here real soon! The chicken pesto crepe was perfect. Best crepe restaurant I have EVER been to. I'm excited to come back that I already know what to order! Strawberry nutella crepe, steak tacos, and chicken&waffles please!
author: Jamie G.

description:
Alright I have been dishing out probably an unfair amount of five star reviews, and I am a little biased on this one as I really like the owner of this place.

Price is a huge part of my reason for giving five stars. Three dollar drafts and 8 dollar crepes with more than generous portions. 

The owner did an awesome job with the menu of this place and building it out.  I highly recommend this place to anyone in the area.
author: Braden B.

description:
I only came here on a fluke while waiting on an overly long reservation down the street.  The 2.50 beer sign caught my eye and the outdoor seating looked inviting.  I grabbed a salad and was impressed by the selection they had on tap for the price.  The service was super duper awesome too, which made a huge difference.
THANKS FOR THE YUMMY DESSERT CREPE ON FRIDAY YAY!!!
author: Britt B.

description:
I've been there the past 3 Wednesday's for lunch.  I had the following:  salmon crepes, Reuben sandwich and clubhouse sandwich.  Love them all.  And I'll be there for lunch again this coming Wednesday for chicken and waffles.  
Oh, and there's free Wifi.
author: Anthony N.

description:
Swung by for brunch with the fam this past Saturday and was thrilled with the experience. A great outdoor seating space (although the tables are wobbly, which means lots of spilled coffee), complete with retractable awnings for shade. A nice, open, inviting interior. A young, hip, ocassionally beautiful crowd. In short, everything you could ask for in a casual brunch spot.

The menu borders on being too big. It takes up four massive chalkboards which hang over the counter, but I guess I shouldn't complain about a place offering options. I went with the Acapulco omelette, which might've been a touch greasy, but I appreciated the generous portions. No idea about the prices; one of the benefits of being the youngest child is that I don't ever pay when I'm out with the fam!

If you're near the Mission or Noe Valley and looking for a fun leisurely brunch spot, you could do a lot worse than to check out The Crepe House.

And you can trust me on this one; I'm an Elite. ;)
author: Sebastian L.

description:
Love it, and our little girl loves it....We eat there at least twice a week when in town. 

Good coffee, extensive sandwich menu and several good choices for the meat-free veggie-oriented crowd (of which I'm a member).
author: Lowell Z.

description: Delicious, savory chicken pesto crepe! I purposely got a to-go box at the beginning of my meal so that I could take home leftovers and enjoy this at home AGAIN! served with a side salad and potatoes. Very filling. Next time (probably tomorrow) I will try a sweet crepe! The strawberry & nutella crepe with ice cream sounded delishhh! Free WiFi.
author: Beverly T.

description: Had the banana foster's crepe and added peanut butter  soooo good! Service was OK and the atmosphere was warm and rustic.
author: Sharon P.

description:
I've walked by this place a few times. It looked ok, and one morning I walked by and saw a girl in the window with a big bowl of Irish Oatmeal. Yum! So I ran in. 
There was no line at all, and only 2 table occupied. 
I asked for the oatmeal and to my surprise, the lady said that they were all out..... O__O What do you mean all out? Your store just opened?!! 
She told me that the oatmeal was for their regulars... OUCH! I was thinking about being a regular... but now that I can't have oatmeal, then I will reconsider. Boo! 

So I ordered, what i thought was something small..... A croissant sandwich. It was MASSIVE!!! It was good... but I wished that I was allowed to have that Oatmeal. 

The End
author: Charliena B.

description: No thought or craft appears present in the making of their dishes. Dry potatoes. Burnt coffee. Unseasoned eggs. More beans than omelet in my omelet. Unsatisfying.
author: Nikki G.

description:
Glad they opened up a crepe style breakfast brunch place near the 24th st. and valencia corridor.    With high ceiling and a brick facade,and wooden tables, its a comfortable and cozy place to eat in the "mish".

Have tried both the omelettes and sandwhiches and while they are not spectacular they are good enough to recommend if you are in the area.

They have extensive outdoor and indoor seating if its nice outside, which is usually the case in the mission or cold outside, then you can always warm up inside with a cup of tea or coffee..  

I like how they offer brunch/breakfast all day.  

The reuben sandwhich was toasted just right and was delicious and juicy.

The ommellete was very big and tasty.

The only downside I can say about this place is the price.  yes you get what you pay for, but the price is on the slight high side, even for being in SF.  

Overall I would recommend as a nice place to sit down grab a bite to eat, the menus have a bit of everything, including huge salads.  You can also get your wine or beer drinky drink on here as well, which is a plus!

You'll find all sorts of people in here, from those sucked into their books and laptops yelping and blogging away, to those in deep conversations about reality TV and the meaning of life.
author: Ferdinand B.

description:
Miami heat was delicious!
Nice place to be on a sunny day esp, with the outdoor seating. Bring yo dog!
author: Flano P.

description: Had a nice omelet here the other day. Great atmosphere and friendly service!
author: Rajesh S.

description:
A bicyclist's food oasis with tons of indoor and outdoor space on the valenica corridor.
Ginourmous portions that come with real mesculin greens sides and country potatoes
1 crepe meal is about $9 and it can easily fill 2 people's bellies
Open early and late and have cheap beer on tap.
Good for people/traffic watching as part of the space is in a new parklet that has reclaimed some of the street.
A definite win for the neighborhood|
FU motorists!
author: G K.

description: Solid and consistent food. Great place to get a decent sized plate of food for not a lot of money. Great for breakfast and lunch.
author: Matt A.

description:
My life is like the creep house, so it makes sense that I would be a fan of a place called The Crepe House.

Anyways, crepes are delicious. Kind of hard to fuck them up. Last time I was here I played Trivial Pursuit, and one of the only answers I got right was about syphilis (YAY MY LIFE IS AWESOME) and then some bitch at our table told me not to hate my life, like hi you granola motherfucker you don't even know me so why don't you save your happy go lucky sunshine garbage for someone who fucking cares, you patchouli whore. 

Uh so crepes are good. Kinda like pancakes but different, and I like to eat my feelings.
author: Jillian M.

description:
Every other week or so I pick up a to-go order of the Crepe House's Asian Chicken Salad when I'm late getting home from work and don't want to make dinner. For all the amazing food along Valencia there's a surprising shortage of good salad options and I appreciate the Crepe House's generous portion size and fresh-grilled chicken.

The crepes are okay but not stellar. I do appreciate their cheap draft beers, especially on a weekend afternoon sitting out in their parklet. 

I've tried a lot of things on the menu and am definitely convinced the Asian Chicken Salad is the best value (a little odd for a crepe place, but I won't complain).
author: C M.

description: This is my absolute most favorite place to get brunch. It's never crowded. The food rocks and the service is amazing. Always friendly, polite, accommodating. I cannot say enough good things about the crepe house!!!!
author: Samantha J.

description: First time here and it was Great . The menu is spectacular , everything literally looked good and sounded good . I had the Hayes omelette but the pesto crepe the new Orleans and crab cake special looked good . The proportion was a great amount definitely filling and the price is certainly not over priced for what your getting. The service is quick and it gets crowed easily . It's a walk in order first then seat yourself . Overall parking is hard because it is a busy and popular street def if you ate able to walk I would recommend it !
author: Tiffany K.

description: It was a "crepe" day. Came over right after Frjte. Ordered the same thing - Nutella & strawberry (a la mode here). The vanilla ice cream was bleh and should've skipped.  Still the crepe was good.  I would try this place again but, so many creperies, so little time.  :)
author: Allen C.

description: I am a true native of San Francisco of 45 years 2nd and my family  has lived in  Noe Valley since the 1930's I have eaten from pier 39 to ocean beach back in the day when we had doggy dinner and this place is my new favorite the best burger I have had in a long time it looked amazing huge and fresh almost intimidated this recently retired Grunt. fries were pretty good but the best will always be  that place by the SF zoo in the 70s and 80s i cant remember the restaurant but they had the best fries. I would have given 5 stars but just found out they do not  deliver anymore and for someone who is trying to fit back into the civilian world that's a no go at this station. but other then that I love it and maybe some day  soon I will  be taking my happy ass out of the house and checking out this place. yes maybe a little expensive I bought two burgers two creeps and almost spent $50. was it worth it ?  YUP and I will do it again but I need to keep my promise first of trying a different place every week.   Thank you Crepe house.
author: Gabriel R.

description: ...consistently good food...quick...friendly efficient staff...what else is needed?...
author: Bob L.

description:
ROACHES

Was there a few nights ago, enjoying my Asian chicken salad and cheap cold beer.  Look down to see a big old cockroach on top of my table staring back at me.  

Didn't want to freak out.  Tried to knock it off my table with the ketchup bottle but it ran onto the underside of the table.  Asked the man who was working the front counter to help me.  He told me they had recently sprayed for roaches so they have come out of their hiding places.  Gross.

He carried my food to another table.  Never checked back with me.  Didn't give me anything for free or offer my money back.  I sat there staring at my salad trying to stop myself from envisioning roaches running through the kitchen and all that gross stuff.  I tried to suck it up and be an adult.  Reminding myself that there are roaches everywhere... and the place otherwise appeared to be clean.  But ultimately I could not eat another bite and left.  

For days I contemplated not writing this review because I do not want to hurt their business.  From what I hear, roaches are common.  (Though this is only the 2nd time I've ever seen one in a SF restaurant.)  But now everytime I bike by this place I get grossed out.  And I really really liked that damn Asian chicken salad but can't imagine ever going back in there again.  Just thought you should know.
author: Sandy S.

description: Everything is so delicious! All sweet or savory crepes and omelets that I've tried have been excellent. The fresh squeezed orange juice is also really good and pulpy. They have really nice outdoor seating as well.
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
The good: Beer and tables outdoors, fun ambiance, and a place to people watch as you relax in the mission.

The bad: Mediocre if not flavorless Miami Heat crepe, and oily crab cakes on the eggs benedict. Oh, and it seems no one buses tables. 

The ugly: The crepe was thick and gummy, almost overdone, and hard to cut through (bad day?)
author: Vittorio L.

description:
Hello Sunny day on Valencia and lunch outdoors! EVERY table out there had at least one cold (and cheap) beer on it.

Asian chicken salad was pretty solid. 

Last but not least, the gal that works the counter in the afternoon is SUPER nice. :)
author: Athena S.

description: A swell place; I ate here twice during a recent trip to Frisco during which I stayed in the Mission. On my first trip, I chanced their crab benedict and fresh OJ on a tender tummy for a late breakfast. I had been poisoned in Chinatown on the previous day, and had passed a long night. Didn't know how food would sit, and a wiser man might have chosen a lighter meal. Still, it was delicious and rejuvenating and sat very well on my stomach. On my next trip, I had their Florentine Crepe, which was also exceptional.  The service was also friendly and attentive. I could eat here every day of the week and twice on Sunday.
author: John S.

description:
Went to the crepe house with some coworkers. Wasnt sure what to expect. The places very clean and inviting. Order at the counter and then go find a table. Pick one outside and enjoy all that Valencia has to offer. 

No booze, but they do have about 5 beers by the bottle and like 7 beers on tap. The menu is pretty large. We ordered a bunch of appetizers. Chicken strips were great. Onion rings were crispy and flavorful. The stars of the show were the potato skins. I enjoyed them so much I got an order togo before I left. (Along with a Bacon cheeseburger) 

I can't speak about the crepes. I did try a bite of the apple pie crepe, and it did taste like apple pie. That's possibly a good sign.  Haha

I would definitely recommend this place for a relaxing, casual lunch or dinner.
author: Chase L.

description: As soon as I came through the door, I knew I had made a mistake because I was standing in front of a huge menu yet nothing was jumping out to me. I ended up getting a fruity nutella crepe. It was big and loaded with strawberries, bananas, and blueberries. But every inch of it was covered in syrupy sauce. It looked crazy because it was colorful, pretty even, but it was all too much. There was nutella sauce, strawberry sauce, and blueberry sauce everywhere. The coffee was not much, just one of those grab and go types. I could make the same cup at home with a cheap coffee maker. This is just another crepe joint that doesn't offer anything out of the ordinary. Points for the big parklet outside though.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
My parents told me they really liked this place and recommended it for a nice brunch to celebrate being done with finals. My mom came by on a late Monday morning.

The place is clean, I was amazed at how clean the bathroom was too. 

I hate it when I have to pay before the food comes, because I don't wanna give a good tip for crappy food. 

I ordered the special with sunny side up eggs, hash browns and pancakes. My mom ordered the strawberry crepe.

All together the order came to about $16-17. Ugh. The food was really mediocre, and the portions were small. My mom didn't like her crepe, she was surprised, "If the place is called 'Crepe House' doesn't it mean it has really good crepes?" Well mom, looks can be deceiving.
author: Sophia G.

description:
This place is a safe haven for suburbanites in the scary---oooooohhh!---Mission. First, just look at the faux-rustic interior, with plastic wood beams on the wall, like the interior of a farmhouse---really?, in the Heart of the Mission?  This place, part of a chain, belongs in a mall.  But it does a thriving business because it looks like a mall restaurant, and delivers the mediocre atmosphere and food the, shall we say unventuresome?, patrons are comfortable with.  This place attracts the same people who eat at McDonald's when they get a package deal on a trip to Paris.

The only time I was trapped into eating here, I ordered a Caesar Salad.  There was grit in the salad because the lettuce was not washed.  I brought it up to the counter and told the tall, unfriendly young male employee  there's grit in this salad.  He said, it's the croutons.  I said, no it's grit. I'm a cook, I know what it is.  Again, instead of saying, Sorry Sir. Is there something else I can get you?, the lunkhead offered me another  Caesar salad.  I said, no, it will be the same.  I'll take a soup. I returned to my seat.   He sullenly brought me the soup, which was bland and watery, and acted passively hostile.  (Boo-hoo on you, Bro'!)

This spiffed-up placeholder is what it appears to be: a restaurant-oid, and it sucks.

But the owners are laughing all the way to the bank, because the crowd from Concord does not feel threatened by this shopping mall chain restaurant, an oasis of the familiar on a street with forbiddingly self-important restos, each a sham in its own way.  Still one does not want to risk feeling exposed as the unworthy rube one knows him/herself to be.  For that, the many are grateful to the Crepevine.
author: x v.

description:
Mm mm!

My boyfriend, friend, and sisters wanted crepes so I suggested The Crepe House. I'm only giving this place 3 stars because parking was difficult. It took us nearly an hour to find parking! We walked about 3-4 blocks to The Crepe House and by the time we arrived, we were starving! It wasn't too packed on a weekday. The menu reminds me of Crepevine's menu.. order, pay, and find a seat. 

I don't remember exactly what everyone got, but I do remember that everything was very good because I had a bite of everyone's plates lol. My only complaint about the restaurant itself is the room temperature water.

Good place to have brunch, lunch, and dinner!
author: Joyce E.

description: The veggie sandwich was delicious!  The eggs florentine was not that great and pretty expensive, would not recommend it. Beer on tap is relatively inexpensive for 2.50 and overall ambiance is nice and comfy
author: Abigail E.

description:
Having this restaurant right across my school is very dangerous! I've been here twice and so far have no bad quarrels with it. The young lady behind the counter is very socialable and helpful.  I've tried their Chicken Pesto Crepe and their Greek Salad.  I was extremely suprised at the size of my meal because they were extremely big. And it's not because I'm petite, but they do give out reasonable portions for the price you pay.  The Chicken Pesto was quite delicious and came with potatoe and a side salad.  Love that it came with a side salad. It made me feel less guilty for wanting to down everything else on my plate...but I didn't as it was very filling.  As for the salad...it was good, but there was too much cilantro in the dressing which kind of disturbed my taste buds a bit. But either than that, the lettuce was not overwhelming the rest of the necessary ingredients some chefs tend to do when making salads.  

The atmosphere is pretty welcoming and relaxing. On some tables they have TRIVIA PURSUIT cards which me and my friend took advantage of even though we knew 2 answers out of the whole box.  You can also people watch if you sit next to the windows. I have not been able to take advantage of their outside seating as I go there at night after class.

One thing I did not like is that the manager, or I assume he was the manager started kicking people out 15 mins before they closed. And also people who came in 30 mins before the restaurant closed, he said that the kitchen was closed. Also on both occassions he never did a "table touch". On one occassion the young lady behind the counter did.

Don't worry Crepe House I'll be back. After all I still the the dessert crepes, pancakes, and waffles to try. Not to mention you do have appetizers...yummy!
author: Zara-Maria S.

description: Exceeded expectations! The pesto crepe is exceptional! And same with the Nutella crepe! The service is fast and friendly! A must go!
author: Mary P.

description: Good food, friendly service, and you never have to wait for a table (well, maybe one outside). Nothing fancy, but when you'd rather actually eat instead of standing in line hungrily staring at your phone, I wouldn't go anywhere else.
author: Brian K.

description: Fast service, friendly servers, a bright atmosphere, and fresh food. No nonsense, nothing crazy fancy, but 100% pleasant. You can't go wrong with any of their crepes. Cheap beer on tap!
author: Ben G.

description:
I've been to so many Crepe Houses, Cafes, Gobbles, Squats and Vines lol, there's so many I can't keep track so I figure they are all the same.

Wrong!!

Came here for a quick bite to eat earlier with my sis. The owner, or cashier when we walked in was such a gentlemen. He was entertaining, funny and helpful with the menu.

I like the seating in the venue more than any other place. I wonder if they have wifi? I figured they did since I seen a person with their laptop. The place was warm and inviting, with music playing in the background. The mission is the warmest area in the city, so the windows were wide open and it makes for some fun people watching.

The menu is so extensive and everything always sounds great.
But, I got the Special or Chicken and Waffles!! Yes!! they served that!
It was delicious!!

Cheap, good and appetizing food.
 
This is my new crepe house =)
author: Sarina I.

description:
They are pretty good for a midday crepe craving. But like some other posters have said, these guys love closing early. I'm not talking about 15 or 30 minutes early; I've come in and gotten turned away 45 minutes prior. 

Nothing wrong with closing at 9 pm, but why claim you're open later? This kind of thing ruins my earlier positive impressions.
author: Ricky B.

description: Love this place. The food is awesome. Please note that the price online is less than the price at the location. Can get busy over the weekends and parking can be a struggle.
author: Gaurav P.

description: Wide selection.  Had the crab cake sandwich.  Prompt service.  Great location.
author: Lorie D.

description: The fresh squeezed O.J. is delicious (and a huge serving for $3.50).  I had the greek salad.  The olives, feta, cucumber and lettuce were all perfect, though the tomatoes were a bit mealy.  I'd love to come back and try the crepes!
author: Charles Y.

description: I got the eggs Benedict. The food wasn't hot enough when it arrived. Staff weren't particularly friendly either. I think there are a lot better places to get food on Valencia for better value and with friendlier staff than The Crepe House
author: Séamus B.

description:
I'm so happy this place opened up on Valencia (walking distance to me = muy convenient).  It's such a warm and cozy environment with surprisingly good food.  if you're in the mood for a crepe, go for the pesto one.  If you want a sandwich, their veggie one is huge.  Their salmon salad is solid (but get a different dressing).

Their beer special rules.  Outdoor seating is a very nice touch.
author: Carol S.

description:
I was around the neighborhood and wanted something to eat and came pass this place and decided to check it out.  

What caught my attention at first are the tables outside that you can eat outdoors.  Then when I walked it was nice and clean.  Organized menu but it was one of those menus you have to look up and have a hurting neck.  I ordered the Frutty Nutella Crepe with an iced soy Chai plus a Chicken-Lemon Sausage for a side order.  I waited about 5 minutes for my order and I was surprised with the size of my crepe and iced soy chai.  As for my sausage it was just one sausage split in half for $3.95! As for the Frutty Nutella it was so good but I think too much on the Nutella but it was still fulfilling.  I had a choice if I wanted whip cream or ice cream on the side but I chose ice cream instead.  =) 

Anyway, what I liked about the place was the ambiance, the food, service of the workers, cleanliness and it can also be a study area.  Music was moderate so it wasn't too loud nor distracting where you can have a lunch date or study during your break.  

The cons of this area is the parking because of course it is Valencia! 

For those who are interested in checking out this place, its between 23rd and 24th Street on Valencia and RIGHT ACROSS from CCSF Mission Campus.
author: Sharjah M.

description:
At first I was like, "eh, I'm not obsessed with crepes, the Mission doesn't really need a crepe shop."

However, upon visiting The Crepe House for a late brunch this past weekend, I take it back!  

BF and I split the Miami Heat crepe, which came out crispy and melty and pretty darn good.  With tossed greens and roasted potatoes, its a hardy dish.  The rest of the menu sounds yummy too-- from pressed sandwiches, to omelettes to pancakes, it seems to have it all.  Plus, they apparently have $2.50 beers!  I will have to come back when I'm not eating breakfast (because even I have limits, people).

The best thing about The Crepe House is the ambiance-- the giant glass front windows, open on a sunny day, make you feel like you're out at a piazza.  A great place to grab a beer and a sandwich or breakfast on a nice sunny day.  Will definitely try it again!
author: Kristin P.

description:
I visited the place on Tuesday evening and ordered Strawberry Crepe (with ice cream). That was really dissapointing. The crepes had almost no taste at all. The strawberries seemed taken from an old compote and tasted really bad. But the ice cream was nice. The portion itself was surprisingly small. 
The pro is that the space is quite big with a high ceiling, a lot of place where to stay. But there is no fun to be in such place if the food is so bad.
author: Ahira P.

description: This place would never be calm in Birmingham. Delicious brunch food. I loved how they played dubstep for the first half hour we were in here just before they changed the station to oldies for the lunch period; much more fitting:) I gladly ate all of my Belgian waffle with fruit, and ate some of my family's Mexican type crepes and a nutella dessert fruit crepe. The staff is very friendly.
author: Justin W.

description: This place is pretty darn good for brunch. I personally think its a better place to eat than Bugaloos which is always packed come brunch time. Their crepes are both delicious and filling, and comes with salads and a side of home fries. If you want some crepes give this place a shot and you shan't be disappointed.
author: David C.

description:
I ordered the Miami Heat crepe, which I probably should've second-guessed since they're currently in the NBA playoffs and I didn't think it'd be right to order.  I don't know why.

In any case, the plate came out, and I was surprised to see that it was bigger than I thought.  It had the savory crepe (wade), the potatoes (james), and the salad (bosh).  I totally underestimated the amount of food, and it ended up winning.

There's probably a lot more I could say to be more witty, but I was pretty full to be honest.  Maybe I was just a-okay with the crepe itself, but whatever.
author: Ren L.

description:
I'm gonna go ahead and give this two stars because of all the chalkboard mafia crepe spots in the city, this one has the best outdoor seating. Despite some truly unpleasant food and coffee I can imagine enjoying an afternoon sitting outside with a bottle of orangina. Also, they have a pretty clean bathroom and don't hide the key up at the front. I probably shouldn't even share this secret on yelp, but I feel like it is a real plus to have a clean, free bathroom on Valencia.

I knew better than to eat here. I definitely knew better than to order a cappuccino, which came in a soup bowl, btw.  I have no excuse other than I was hungry after yoga and my car was parked nearby, I wasn't in the mood for falafel or a burrito so I thought I'd take a chance. I mean, how far wrong could a crepe go? Imagine an underdone pancake wrapped around a heap of chewy cheddar cheese with about a cup of cottage cheese in the center. *Sarcastic mmmmmmmm*. 

I decided to let it go and just forget about the fact that I had wasted twelve bucks on that mess. I thought maybe some water might help wash things down. It's a self serve situation, which is totally fine, but the plastic cups like we used to get juice during snack time at preschool in were all wet and stuck together. I remembered some sanitation class I took when I worked at a bakery a long time ago where we learned that dishes need to be dry in order to be sanitized. I let the water idea go and went home sad. I felt a little better when I considered that even though I didn't eat much for what I paid, it wasn't like I was still hungry. Kinda nauseous but not hungry.

Anyway, I'll probably be in a situation where I forget this experience and end up eating here again. Even this place probably has a line for brunch on the weekends.
author: Naomi M.

description: I loved the friendly staff from the moment I walked into the Crepe House.  The service was fantastic and the food was delicious!  There was ample seating and fresh water available if you didn't want to order a drink. The menu had lots and lots of choices at reasonable rates. I had a hard time choosing what I wanted, but finally settled on the Hawaiian Crepe topped off with the strawberry dessert crepe.  I was not disappointed.  It was fresh and a great combination of foods to create two wonderful crepes.  I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves crepes, ommlettes, salads and more!
author: Suzanne P.

description: Every time I come here I enjoy it. Ok, I've only been here two times. But both were excellent. Very friendly staff. You can sit outside with the pooch, and the crepe selection is outta this world. I had the pesto chicken the first time. The 2nd time I was there I had penne with sundried tomatoes, chicken, sausage, and this incredible cream sauce. Yummers. Plus beer on tap? I'm in love.
author: Rob W.

description: I was wandering the streets of the Mission on Sunday evening looking for a reasonable place for dinner. My friends weren't in the mood for a wait, crowd or noise so this was our first choice. I feared it would be chilly given the high ceilings but it was warm inside and the staff very attentive and friendly. I must be the only person on Yelp to go with the Crab Benedict and I was not disappointed. It came with a healthy, fresh and perfectly ripe fruit salad and I was lucky enough that my friends were willing to share their rosemary home fries. Great choice on a street filled with the trendy...
author: Susangela M.

description:
A great brunch. Although I am not a huge fan of ordering at the front and getting a number (something about not having a server to ask questions bugs me). This place gets a thumbs up for food, presentation, quality and quantity.

They offer much more than just crepes. You can choose from sandwiches to salads, soups and much much more. 

The reason they got only 4 stars is because the crepes (although good) were not real crepes. They were too thick...closer to a Dutch Pannekucken or a German Eierkuchen. The whole thing about crepes is that they are thin. I would suggest they add some sparkling water and more eggs. Other than that, the flavors were great. 

Our Mimosa was a bit small (more orange juice than chamgane) and a bit costly, but it tasted fresh squeezed. If you are not a fan of a lot of pulp, don't order these here.

We also had some French Toast...not regular French Toast though..This was corn flake crusted French Toast...CAn someone say OMG...Holy Cow...AMAZING. And the pan fried home potatoes are to die for. I would go back for those alone.

For pictures and more notes about the Crepe House, see my Evernote Food notes at
https://www.evernote.com/shard/s63/sh/98b9ccf5-e2b2-4ebc-81ef-8e8cf213c2c5/f9ccc80148c929e6bda552df4a0fe99a
author: Coreen C.

description: Just ordered a delivery via post mates. The Nutella pancakes were good, so was the ice cream. Only disappointment was the strawberries because they tasted like they were from a tin. Fresh ones would have been so much nicer! I would eat here again but just order Nutella pancakes on their own.
author: Kelly M.

description:
This is a great neighborhood cheap crepe place.  

I actually had their spaghetti in bolognese sauce, which was large portion, super homey comfort food.  Ended with a strawberry desert crepe.  All my friends liked their respective crepes too.  Cheap comfort meal place!
author: Li Y.

description:
I really want to love it because: 
a) Awesome ambiance - spacious, cool, clean
b) Reasonably priced food in the mission
c) NO LINE on a Saturday?!

But it's hard because: 
d) The food just wasn't that great.

We came here for breakfast on a Saturday and the cashier insisted that yes, in fact, I do need two kinds of cheese in my Med. crepe. I beg to differ, friend. it really just came out overly cheesy in the oily kind of way. Should've gone with my gut and asked them to hold the cheddar.

My sister had the Acapulco omelette, which was pretty good, but still tasted like it needed some salt. The one great thing was the rosemary potatoes! I'll eat those again any day.

In any case, love having the restaurant in the 'hood for a quick bite - but would honestly rather wait in line for amazing brunch vs. just so-so.
author: Gretchen S.

description: I got the salmon crepe, which was quite good. Potatoes on the side had good flavor, but were slightly undercooked. Service was fast and courteous.
author: Stuart B.

description: when you can't think of what you want for lunch, just stop in here. there is something for every taste. the savory crepes and huevos rancheros are my go-to choices. they have pretty good salads. plenty of outdoor seating.  the owners are good people as well.  working in the mish, we always find ourselves back here, so it must be good.
author: Roy N.

description: The food is delicious, very reasonably priced, with friendly, helpful service and a pleasant interior. Highly recommend!
author: Will K.

description:
I am currently at Crepe House using wifi and eating the Salmon Crepe.

Pros:
- big open windows, outdoor seating, good vibe
- you don't leave hungry if you eat everything on your plate
- free wifi
- pleasant enough service

Cons:
- the food
- the salmon crepe is one of the worse tasting things I've had in a while.  I'm eating it now... or at least trying to.  I often order salmon crepes at crepe restaurants.  Most recently I had the salmon crepe at The Creamery and it was exponentially better.
- I've eaten here in the past.  While it was never great, it wasn't this bad either.
author: Lylan M.

description: recently revisited for sunday brunch. Even though there were only three of us present I was pretty happy to see that the joint was group friendly. I saw parties of 10 or more seated at the high tables and a bunch of low tables put together too. Who doesn't like brunch? Good for you Crepe House for making brunch group accessible for those who like to partake.
author: Geralyn Y.

description:
Avoid avoid avoid. Do yourself a favor, go to Fritjz instead. 

I wanted to like this place so bad, it's less than a block from my house, they have water bowls outside for dogs, and I freaking love crepes. But this was hands down the worst crepe I have ever had. 

All of their crepes have way too many ingredients, they pile too much crap in them. I got a Hawaiian because it was the closest they had to a basic ham and cheese. They put way too much cheddar in it (like more cheddar than crepe), what seemed like ham out of the Walgreens fridge, absurdly huge chunks of pineapple and a bunch of uncooked onion. And then they dumped what tasted like McDonalds sweet and sour McNugget sauce on top of it. It was a greasy pile of goo. 

One of my friends ordered a salmon salad and the piece of salmon was literally the size of a large coin and that was it. We shared some fries and they were pretty obviously frozen grocery store fries. 

The only good things I can say is that the people who work here are nice, and there is a lot of seating.
author: Beth D.

description:
Crepe House continues their takeover of San Francisco with this new third location. Just like the others, a nice selection of breakfast items, sandwiches, salads and of course crepes. It would be odd if they didn't serve those, no?

My tofu sandwich was made exactly to order, and really appreciated the tofu looked/tasted as if it was grilled with minimal oil. It was good eats, and came with my choice of potatoes (no), french fries (nope) or side salad (yes please).

All good, nothing too memorable, a buck or two lower on the price (almost $10) would earn them another star.
author: Jason B.

description: The salmon crepe is decent but the potatoes are what really make the meal! This place has both indoor and outdoor setting, but it can get crowded and you may have to wait for a table. I believe that the food is overpriced but decent. They also serve mimosas which is a plus. It's in the heart of the mission, so after your meal you could walk up and down mission to check out the stores and other bars.
author: Kat P.

description:
Crepe house had everything on my mind after a long day from new years eve. Fully FULFILLED my appetite.

MOCHA (check)
Pesto Crepes with Chicken (check)
Side dish of red potatoes and a balsamic salad (check)
& a special person to eat brunch with (check)
author: Angelica A.

description: This place was alright. The portions of their crepes were small. I had the banana and nutella crepe. Nothing special. I had a better crepes at the Godfather cafe in SOMA. Service was prompt though, but the prices were a lil steep for such tiny crepes...
author: Diana M.

description:
It seems like the middle eastern crepe mafia opened another generic crepe house on Valencia. They definitely spent a lot of money on the interior designm which is hilarious, and they have free wifi and tons of power outlets. This is good for freelance working and freeloading web surfers. 

What's not good is the shitty blasting reggae music. Look, I like roots and dub and other island shit (YOUNG IZ WHAT), but how much Spear Uhuru Burning Spliff can you fucking listen to. Especially really loud. Maybe it's that idea if you inflict some minor pain, maybe you can ignore what really hurts. Leaves a lot to the imagination.
author: Jafon H.

description:
I wanted to like this place. It recently opened about 1 block from my apartment so it's super convenient for me to stop by. It's on the great street of Valencia, has outdoor seating, and is quite spacious. On top of that, beers are on tap for $2.50. So, you are thinking, what's not to like? Well, their main products - food and drink - are unimpressive. The beer is flat (signs of being old). The food is barely mediocre - I ordered a lox bagel and was given a pile of old, smelly fish. I complained and the first employee didn't seem to understand what lox is. Another employee kindly apologized and offered me some lentil soup. But the soup tasted like it was warmed from a can. My wife had the Greek salad. It was fine but nothing stellar.

There are other Crepe Houses around the city. I've not been to them but they all appear to have cool atmospheres (fun woodwork, casual and spacious atmosphere, and a fun-looking menu). But since there are so many amazing eateries in the Mission, I can't recommend this place over others that are a block away. OK, maybe I'll go back for the $2.50 flat beers when I'm bored.
author: Carter F.

description: Thank goodness I changed my order when I saw the Corn Flake French Toast! They were perfect! I shared with the hubby and he was a fan as well. We now have a new spot to bring the families (no more same old, same old).
author: Liz A.

description:
Hey this place was pretty good.

Great cheap prices with a large selection of crepe (and non-crepe items) and plenty of vegetarian options.

This place reminded me of crepevine.  There are about 5-6 tables outside and its pet friendly so feel free to bring your pooch.  There is also a bowl of water for dogs, but doesn't look like its very clean and there is a large container of milk bones for your dog.

I had the pesto crepe which was pretty good and the potatoes that came with it were really good and crispy.

My boyfriend had the hawaiian crepe (ham, cheese and pineapples) which he said was also really good.

I highly recommend.
author: Kameron K.

description:
I've been here about 3-4 times since they've opened. However, all it takes is one negative experience for me to never come back. This occurred this past Sunday (06/05/11) afternoon. 

The guy behind the counter is someone who should not be the face of your business. First he was only nice and friendly to the young girls. By the time I stepped up, not much was said and after I ordered he snatched the 20 outta my hands like he was afraid I'd run off or something. As I paid, and then grabbed my to go order there was not even a thank you..let alone a word said. I almost regret leaving a tip, but it's not the cooks' fault.

For a place with food that is about average, your customer service should be on point. Anyway, I've experienced good customer service here by the women working the counter. That is why I give this place 2 stars instead of 1. Without this past negative experience, my rating would've been at least a 3.
author: Pico S.

description:
Pros: Big, spacious, free wifi, healthy options, our food came out quickly.
Cons: Greek salad was virtually tasteless, the dressing was no good, and way too little toppings, it was all lettuce. The service was so-so, not exactly welcoming.

I won't be back.
author: Elena T.

description: Nice lunch spot - fresh options and outdoor seating.
author: Vicki L.

description: My friends and I went there for brunch and it was delicious!  I ordered the pesto crepe and it was so good.  One of my roommates ordered the apple crisp crepe and it wasn't too heavy but just sweet enough for the morning.  I will definitely be back.
author: Claudia L.

description: Yes it was around 12pm,I was so hungry since i didn't have anything from the other night I decided to try this place so I walked in ordered two pancakes, bacon n eggs ..I won't say it doesn't taste good  coz yes I liked the food.. I really love bacon but that day The moment I bite the bacon I felt something weird I tried the other slice of bacon and felt the same way so I had to stop eating bacon.. Later that evening I was feeling so uncomfortable, I was feeling dizzy, and felt like throwing out.. Came home from work.. I was still not feeling well  but I thought that's just because I was walking under the sun that day, tried sleeping but couldn't later I tried to go to the bathroom coz my stomach started paining my heading was rolling over I was tho ring up at the same time.. I couldn't help myself from getting off the floor.. I had the worst pain ever all over my body.. Was having diarrhea plus throwing up and also my eyeballs  were about to come out, fortunately I could atleast talk.. I called my sister and I'd to go to ER AND. The doctor said I got food poisoned.. Doesn't mean the they put poison in food.... I didn't want to say it but yes that's true.. Coz I didn't eat anything before or after that food.... Horrible one.. So I just wanted to say is that do not serve old food.. That's all thanks
author: Passang T.

description:
Not bad for a chain!  I enjoyed the food more than I expected to.  For $8-9, you get a pretty darn substantial crepe with plenty of fillings, a bit of green salad, and a pile of home fries.  Beers are $2.50 on tap, & they do wine & shochu cocktails for $4-5 as well (which I would've skipped since I'm usually not a fan, but I'd ordered the mango mojito before I thought about it, and it was completely drinkable, if a little fake-sweet in the mango department).

I had a Mediterranean crepe and my boyfriend had the pesto chicken - we enjoyed both just fine (and enjoyed that we only had to walk about a block & a half).  Service was good (the dude who made the mojito insisted I taste it before he left).  There is outdoor seating, which is awesome, and Carter F. will be relieved to know that the music is not exclusively reggae (we got a smattering of indie / singer-songwriter / sting while we were there) and that my bf actually thought his beer was quite carbonated.

No, it's not Ti Couz.  Nor does it seem to want to be.  In fact, it's a completely different style of crepe altogether.  It's not nearly as good, but it's a HELL of a lot cheaper.  In addition to crepes, you can also get salads, sandwiches, & omelets, which I haven't tried, but it's good to know they're close by & cheap.

One reservation - their sign says they're open til 10, but when we tried to go before & poked our heads in at about 9:40, the girls behind the counter said, "Sorry, we close at 9:30."  My bf mentioned that they might want to change the sign if that was the case since it said 10.  One of them just nodded & said, "Uh-huh, thanks, goodnight."  So that was a little off-putting, and we'll never try to go after 9:30 again.
author: Angela B.

description:
Faster wifi than my school across the street.
Great bagels w/ big red tomato slices! Yum.
Workers are always friendly and helpful.

Thumbs up.
author: Astro S.

description: Finally a place in the Inner Mission located in a convenient area where I can eat crepes. It seems like most of these crepe places have the same looking menu everything down to the colors and fonts. Anyway I always try to order something on the menu that looks unique and that was The Sopranos crepe. It came with a small salad and some fried potatoes. Not bad. I was able to check-in with the yelp app since they have free wi-fi here too. I'll definitely be back to try out their dessert crepes. I only noticed that on my way out.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Doable. Is how I'd describe the Crepe House. 

I used to eat lunch here almost everyday (turkey reuben, acapulco). 

I'd pay 20% more if they upped the quality of ingredients. You can taste it if you go here enough. 

Outside seating is terrific on a nice day. 

Avoid the coffee (again if they upped the quality i.e. ritual/four barrel I'd pay for it and it'd go a long way). 

Service is great. Staff is amazing and friendly. 

Great to have a place with a ton of variety and plenty of seating right on Valencia St.
author: Ethan B.

description:
My favorite remote working location, because why work in Starbucks when you can order GOOD BEER at pretty much the same price (i.e. $2.50 a pint.) The Asian chicken salad is quite good, the crepes are not bad. Good wireless and power outlets everywhere.

Just wish it stayed open a lot later -- dudes, you're losing a lot of customers who'd keep coming until 2am for the beer. Just close the kitchen at 9:30 and keep serving drinks!
author: James A.

description: Ew.  This food wasn't even worth finishing.  The crepe itself was bland, and the fillings were mushy and low in flavor.  I will not go back.
author: Sam E.

description: This place is ok.  When we walked in, the tempting aroma of savory crepes was thick in the air but we were in the mood for some dessert.  The restaurant looked clean and they were playing some cool Latin music that reminded me of the Buena Vista Social Club.  It was kind of trippy to eat crepes which is French and have Latin music playing in the background. But who am I to complain if the music was good? I spent $7+tip on a small crepe that had nutella, bananas, chocolate syrup and berries in it.  It was good but it was so tiny that Loverboy and I inhaled it in less than three minutes.  I think it took longer for us to receive the crepe than us consuming it. We were debating on ordering a second one since we were feeling kinda piggy. We decided not to since it was a bit pricey.  For that price, I expected more fruit and a bigger crepe.  They do have specials on beer that I would like to check out next time.  They carry Blue Moon which I think is awesome. Hopefully their savory crepes are bigger than the dessert crepes.  I am a much happier piggy when my belly is full!
author: Shirleyanne A.

description:
Great location and food!  I love their crunchy french toast.  Tofu scramble was great, too.  They have free wifi!   

And the bonus for me is outside seating.  I am always looking for places I can go with my dog, Mochi.
author: Hiromi M.

description: food's hit or miss. the same order can feel like it came from a completely different kitchen from one day to the next. the service has been consistently sweet and staff recognized my study partner and i as regulars and treated us as such. i keep going back for the unpretentious atmosphere and the kind service.
author: Jess B.

description: It was pretty good. Just like it's cousin store, Crepé Vine. Pretty decent happy hour. I think the beer on tap was only $2.50.
author: Manuel M.

description: Food is fine. Great selection. But this restaurant needs to learn that hot food should be HOT. The hot chocolate was luke warm, and the cheese omelet had hard, barely melted cheese. Otherwise, good service and pleasant decor.
author: mary h.

description: Pretty good crepes and great prices! For a Friday night, it wasn't super busy, which was awesome, since every other restaurant on the street had long waits. Don't let this deter you if you're too cool for school. The food is good and staff is friendly, and that's what really matters. Save Baretta for a night when you're a little more organized about your outing.
author: Chris S.

description: Good location. Great atmosphere with a lot of space. The seating layout is great. I find it a good place for a meeting or to just kind of hide from people while also people watching (hard to explain). I always feel welcome here to stay as long as I want and get work done on my laptop while I eat. Staff recognizes regulars.  Food is always exceptional. The place overall is very well managed. I rarely give good reviews... theres just not much to complain about here.
author: H K.

description: If I was a regular coffee drinker, I would be getting my mocha here every single day. I don't know what it is, but this is the best in the city! Food is awesome, portions HUGE.  Omelettes, Crepes, and other breakfast favorites. Salads, Sandwiches, Pasta. Order your food at the counter, they bring it to your table. (Love this). Service pleasant and efficient. Love the Asian Salad and Waffles.
author: Jodie S.

description: Good food, reasonable prices, nice decor, outdoor seating available. The Penne Guilliamo is really good and comes in a large portion size for your money.
author: Paul L.

description:
We accidentally ended up here while looking for a cheap lunch spot and "wow ... that's long time we haven't had a crepe, let's try it!".  The staff is a bit "frozen", definitely far from being enthusiastic, but the food is good. I had a crepe with eggplant (tomato, onions, pesto ...) and it was delicious. Ok, maybe the eggplants themselves could have been a little softer but the overall flavour was great. The pancake itself was also delicious, even if very different from an original  "galette", i.e. savoury crepes from the Brittany (Northwest of France) made with buckwheat flour.  Good accompanying salad, as well. Anything else to  declare: yes, huge portion!

4 stars considering also the high ratio quality/price
author: Andrea L.

description: omg you can get your drink on cheaply here.  beer by the pint for next to nothing.  end of review.
author: Amy M.

description: The menu here is so large it's overwhelming. It takes up about 4 full sized chalk boards. The person behind the counter just looked at us never saying a word so we just started ordering. The total was voiced and that's it. OK, so we sit down, the food is brought out about 15 minutes later. That was the last contact (so really, none) that we had with any employee in the restaurant. 2 stars for ok food.
author: Angela N.

description: After finding this place on Yelp and walking through SF for 15 minutes, my family was so glad that we found this place. Big portions, nice service, a very family-friendly atmosphere, and relatively cheap food made for a great breakfast! Coffee was really good and everything tasted great. Although the line went out the door and the restaurant is quite compact, the line gave us time to decide what we wanted and we had no trouble finding a table once we had ordered. If in the area again, we will definitely come back.
author: Matthew H.

description: Dog friendly, outdoor dining (I had to clear my own table though, delicious pastas. I had the Penne and my friend Malou had the Spaghetti. Very large portions. We had split a Banana Foster Crepe and that was pretty delicious. Meatball (My toy poodle) and I will be back for more!
author: Gessa C.

description:
Great Food for a Great Price!
I enjoyed the time I had there with my boyfriend (nice date place or even friends night out), I recommend this place if you love savory crepes with Pesto! Its just wonderful with lots of space and our waiter was very kind to us.
author: Liz T.

description:
My friend and I went walking around to explore one night, since I'm new to Mission, and stopped in for a couple of beers. $2.95 all day for beer on tap? SCORE! We had already eaten dinner, but thought it was a chill place to talk and people watch. Then, I stopped in a few days later with my Ipad in hand, Free WiFi (yay), ordered the grilled chicken sandwich (yum) and a latte. Latte was normal, but sandwich was yummy. 

All in all, it is a great place to study or hang out. Definitely coming back to try a few more menu items and drink some more beer :)
author: Selena G.

description:
We were walking along to have lunch somewhere and this place was the only place open at 3pm for lunch, and man were we glad we went!  They had large windows that were open, so you had the feeling of sitting outside, and they also had outdoor seating!!!!

We shared the Eggplant sandwhich, that was fantastic then had the berry sweet crepe and OMG it was super delicious!!!!  

I would definately go back again!
author: claudia h.

description: I came back and had the eggplant sandwich and......it was actually really good! I eat a lot of eggplant, so I'm pretty picky, but I do love a good vegetarian sandwich since a lot of places don't even give one as a menu option. Thanks guys!
author: Shira O.

description:
It's been so long since I've had a good crepe that I had great difficulty choosing from the many enticing crepe combinations on the menu at Crepe House. I settled for the Mediterranean: cheese, onions, tomatoes, olives, feta, red peppers, avocado and artichokes. This classic combination of ingredients filled a void in my soul. 

At first, I was somewhat concerned with the fact that most of the crepes on the menu run close to $10, but when my dish arrived, I was pleasantly surprised by the portion size of the crepe, as well as the deliciously filling rosemary potatoes and beautifully dressed salad that come with it. I'd also like to mention that they have a handful of quality beers on tap! 

Now that I know they're the real deal, I've gotta go back to try a few other interesting crepe dishes. Even though they're considered a breakfast/brunch establishment, the Crepe House is an excellent option for any meal of the day.
author: Seth F.

description: Very tasty & satisfying! The atmosphere is very organized, clean, & unique. It's a great place to go for a delicious lunch. I ordered the chicken pesto crepe & goodness was it fulfilling! It might be a tad bit pricey, but at the end of the day it was a worthy investment! I highly recommend this location to anyone!
author: Andrew G.

description: Came to eat here with a friend after yoga.  Environment was pleasant, social, open, a bit on the louder side.  Indoor/Outdoor seating.  Crepes were yummy- I'm a fan of their mochas!  If you drive, you most likely will need to pay street parking.
author: A T.

description: Great place. Food is only okay, but free coffee refills, fast wifi and electric outlets galore make this the ideal weekend office space.
author: E-dough R.

description:
This is a great new restaurant!

I had a 'New Orleans' crepe and it was everything I expect from a local crepe place. Very satisfying. And the rosemary potatoes that came with it are awesome too. And some salad greens, yay. Oh, and when I ordered a decaf mocha the lady behind the counter totally asked if I wanted whipped cream and seemed to get that that is the most important part ;-)

The decor is a little wacky, but I like it. The huge front window opens to let in fresh air! And, if you go soon, you can see the nervous (my guess is) owner-guy be cutely nervous and try to be helpful while not having anything to do cause he's hired competent staff. (I enjoy people watching and so watching everyone get used to their new roles was fun.)

So, yeah, not the best restaurant I've ever been to, and as was mentioned before, very different from Ti Couz, but a totally solid, yummy, reasonably priced brunch option that I can walk to from home. So I'm writing this review because I definitely want it to stick around.
author: Dani G.

description:
Listen all you Hipsters! I'm convinced The Crepe House puts drugs in their food! Their  Corn Flake battered challah french toast is so god damn good make you wanna go back for more! Hmm! I mean really, this place is obnoxiously cool. Real maple syrup? Yup! Keep it up people. This french toast is absolutely ridiculous. It's disgusting. And good to! The mix of fresh berries and banana on top are not only fantastic but create the illusion you are eating a well rounded meal, thus lessening any terrible guilt that may accompany such bliss as this.
They would get five stars if their potatoes had some more attention and they served real jam. The customer service is evident and lets not forget the unforgettable french toast. 
(its really nice to snack on leftover french toast in the evening ;-)
author: Russell W.

description:
It's a nice place for Brunch - because of the environment, not the food

I love love love the design for this place and mission district:)
I went there on a sunny day. My friend and I were super hungry, so we decided to stop yelping and just go into a random place for brunch.
SO we picked this place, the place looks nice, not very crowded;)
we ordered, a spinach crepe and a 2by2by2, the food were alright. it wasn't too pricey.

I would definitely come back, not for the food, but for the environment. Although I am a big food lover, but I get tired of the wait, usually I would go to mama's if I want a good decent brunch, but there is always a line...and its always so windy at northbeach. If you don't wanna wait, definitely come to this place and enjoy the sun and the nice environment.
author: Christy Y.

description: Amazing Rosemary potatoes! Great coffee. Didn't actually try the crepes, but the crabcake Florentine  was excellent. Excellent enough to make me overlook the awful New Orleans jazz music playing. My friend had the Belgian waffle and gave it a 3 out of 5.
author: Mary S.

description: I work near here and when I want a great salad this is my go to place. The salmon cobb or the mexican chicken, you can't go wrong. Nice portions for sit in or take out.
author: sumaya g.

description: Breakfast brunch or lunch. I can never go wrong here. Love the Sicilian omelette
author: Vic R.

description: Went here at eating at Beretta (the portions were so small, we were still hungry). Wish we had gone here first! Delicious food and portions that will actually fill you up!
author: Kaitlin J.

description:
Very nice interior of wood and brick, in a nice area.

Service was friendly but a little slow. I was the first customer of the day so maybe the stove was still cold.

I had a nice nutella crepe. The portions are average and the price is high for what it is:

$8.63 for a single crepe and a tea. Not cheap!

Eating out is SF is getting more and more expensive!
author: Anastasia M.

description: Yum! I had brunch here this morning with a new friend. We sat on the patio and both really enjoyed our picks. She had the Hawaiian and was at first skeptical of the sweet and sour sauce... But was pleasantly surprised at how much she liked her order. I had the pesto crepe and got extra mixed greens in sub of the potatoes. It was super yummy and not too filling either. Watch out for the tables outside. They are a little wobbly and we spill our coffees 5 or 6 times but it was a great pick an I'll definitely be going back. I had my eye on their chicken special.
author: Autumn B.

description: I had wonderful crepes here (savory and sweet) every time, plus the yummy salad and potatoes. I don't know what people are complaining about... Picky hipsters wanting something nouvelle? Crepes are rich and decadent. Accept it or go eat raw celery! Also, the staff was so kind and polite and respectful to the elderly friend I brought with me. So rare in this city to find anyone with manners and respect for our elders.
author: Psy D.

description: Lots of open space. Free WiFi and good food.  This is my go-to spot for breakfast / lunch meetings in the mission.
author: Darius M.

description: Decent place for breakfast, fresh ingredients, nothing fancy.
author: P G.

description: I went to the Crepe House for lunch today. And ordered the Augus Char-broil Burger well..... I have better hamburgers like theirs, I mean the burger was two stories high with the meat topped off with lettuce, tomatoes, and red-onion and fries. Where to start? Start with the burger well... the hamburger was kinda dry for a well-done type deal on a huge Kaiser Bun and the French Fries they killed it the fries look like something I would get at a McDonalds on 24th Street HURT!!!! I can better fries at Jay's Cheesesteak for $3.95 or at Phat Philly. If I want dry ass fries I would take myself to a Burger King there fries stay warm enough until you say UGH!!!. My vote is it's okay. And my advice is don't order the Hamburger. My suggestion is go to Jay's Cheesesteak, Big Mouth or Burger Joint. Crepe House should be a light bar was with WIFI and another coffee shop in the Mission. And for new mothers with babies.
author: Chris Ackord P.

description: Another one of these chain crepe places, but everything is pretty solid and I find myself here a good amount, so it must be good. Good proportions, varied menu, cheap beer. The only thing I don't like is the coffee and the home fries.
author: Alex A.

description: Love the crepes!  Well worth the money spent which was little to nothing.  Outdoor seating to people watch and plenty of street parking if you get there before 9 am....lol
author: Shar I.

description: Everything I've had at the crepe House is excellent, the staff are always friendly and willing to go the extra mile, food is served quickly and always hot and they are always happy to make any changes needed or make something original. I've been maybe 7-8 times and can say I've always been 100% satisfied. I almost always get one of their many crepes so I can't speak for the whole menu but everything looks good.  Very solid option all around.
author: Louis P.

description: The warm chicken salad is fantastic! Sun dried tomatoes on top make it pretty killer, and it is more than enough food for a full meal.
author: Ross A.

description: The people workign here are very nice but there is something off with the food. Its just not memorable. Thats about as much as I can say.
author: William M.

description: Yet another pretentious brunch place that caters to both hipsters and yuppies. EXACTLY what the neighborhood needed.
author: Andy Z.

description: Great place with a casual atmosphere.  We came back here a couple times for dessert right after dinner. It's well priced, the dessert crepes are great, and the staff is very friendly!
author: Anshu A.

description: I think the cheap beer is the only thing that draws me here. It looks just like Squat and Gobble.. not sure if they are owned by the same people. Which means, the breakfast crepes are probably better than the lunch/dinner crepes. I'd give it a try again, maybe for beer and brunch.
author: Stephanie U.

description: The crepes here are amazing! Banana Foster is by far my favorite. The home fries and side salad are a perfect addition to the lunch crepes! And not to mention the affordable drinks, the Bloody Mary was poured very generously and topped off the whole meal. Great place, will definitely return!
author: Megan E.

description:
despite the exposed brick, wood construction, some thing about this cavernous place feels characterless to me. I've avoided coming in. But I overcame my suspicions this weekend to try it out. to my regret.

I had the salmon crepe. It was a huge bland pile of nothing. I couldn't get it down. The salmon was overcooked into paste, and the whole thing (with provolone cheese - an odd choice that I was also suspicious of.. correctly as it turned out) had no flavor. It was weird - I couldn't taste any individual things in it even though it looked like it had greens and salmon and cheese and other stuff.

The hash brown/potatoes looked nice, very crispy and brown. But they had no flavor either, It was like everything was a reconstituted replica made from the same ingredients. 

Definitely not worth the price. I guess it was filling? I ended up eating more just an hour or so later, because I wanted to taste something flavorful.

The joint is overrated, at least for savory stuff. Maybe the sweets are the way to go.
author: La M.

description:
I came here for a Saturday afternoon lunch. I was a little skeptical because I always think of crepes as being just for dessert, but I was pleasantly surprised. I had the chicken pesto crepe and my fiance had the Hawaiian. 

The chicken pesto comes with mozzarella, pesto, garlic, basil and tomatoes. It was bursting with flavors, just so delicious. It comes with a salad and rosemary potatoes. Everything was so tasty, I ate it all! My fiance was also raving about his Hawaiian crepe. I was amazed that we ate for $20 - hands down it's the best cheap lunch out there. 

I hope to be back!
author: Katie S.

description:
surprisingly good food!

we were looking for a late breakfast on a friday morning and hungrily stumbled into this place. the decor is pretty neat: exposed beams and bench seating made from patchwork hides. 

as we were just starting what would be a long day of city walking and riding bikes, we were thrilled to see a tofu scramble on the menu. we were expecting some sort of breakfast-looking thing but it was so much better! this was a crazy dinner setup with carmelized onions, greens, potatoes, and peanut sauce. sooooo good and sooooo what we needed. 

the rest of the menu had plenty of variety and my bet is that everything else is prepared as creatively as our dish. i would definitely go back.

now if only they'd do something about that adult contempo music that was undermining my awesome experience...
author: Anne R.

description:
This is a great place for kids! As parents of a 2 year-old living in the Mission, it can be hard to find truly kid-friendly restaurants. Not to say that other places are hostile, but the atmosphere can be distracting for a little one. :-)

Crepe House highlights:
- good food at reasonable prices
- a kids menu (the only one in the neighborhood that I know of)
- quiet (grateful that they don't blare their music) and friendly
- attentive and kind staff (Yuko is fantastic, and has saved my wife on more than one occasion)
- Open early and late

All in all, its a great addition to the neighborhood and a fantastic new place for Mission parents.
author: Gabriel G.

description: Great food, friendly service, always an open table (even during brunch on weekends!). Breakfast dishes are particularly tasty. Try the french toast - it's thick with a crunchy cornflake crust. So good.
author: Jenn D.

description: Good food, great atmosphere, outdoor seating on Valencia...you had me at Crepe.
author: M H.

description: What i love most about this place besides the apple pie is their decorations. Its so cute and friendly! Its like going to a middle eastern cafe with a lot of good breakfast menus:) The environment is nice and they have gigantic windows which lets a lot of sun comes in which is perfectly awesome.
author: Cavin T.

description: I have been here a few times. It's a great place to meet up with friends. They offer free wifi and not to mention the beer is cheap $2.50!
author: SF S.

description: Sooooo delicious and filling for the price!  A student's go to breakfast joint!  The potatoes are always perfect and absolutely delicious.  Order anything, as they are all good.  The portions have gotten a bit smaller and less avocado over the years, but otherwise... still good!
author: Trifectaus J.

description: Good food, amazing chai lattes, and plenty of outlets to satisfy my workaholic self.  I'll definitely be back here the next time I'm in search of a cute wi-fi cafe.
author: Stephanie T.

description: I wasn't blown away, and the kitsch of the decorations aren't really my type of thing, but the crepe was solid, and the potatoes and mixed greens salad it comes with were tasty enough.  Since it's quite close to my apartment, I could see myself coming back, but if it wasn't further away, it didn't make enough of an impression for me to do so.  Nice and big; I could see it being a good fallback if another place nearby was full or had a wait.
author: Zachary R.

description: Disappointing Eggs Florentine!  The eggs were completely overdone to the point where the yolk was cooked through like hard boiled eggs.  I never send my food back, but I couldn't stomach such a dry concoction (the english muffin and spinach were also dry and overcooked) without the runny poached eggs.  They brought out new poached eggs and threw in extra potatoes, which were dry and overcooked as well.  One of the new poached eggs turned out ok, but the second one was overcooked.  Not as bad as my first batch so I ate them anyway.  The whole meal was flavorless along with the hollandaise sauce.  I will not be back.  It's too bad too because I like the big open space and outdoor seating.
author: Lynda N.

description: Ok, I've only had a beer here, but it was a $2.50 Blue Moon, so I'm diggin it. The food looks great and plenty to choose from under $10. They were also playing great muzak when I was there.
author: e w.

description: After many years of excellent meals at the Crepe House on Gough, it was incredibly disappointing to try this "new" location only to have one of the worst meals I've ever had in my entire life!  We went for brunch and I ordered one of the most basic dishes ever:  a cheese omelette with a side of fruit.  The omelette was bland and greasy, not to mention flat and a bit rubbery, and the fruit salad looked like it was made two weeks ago with poor-quality fruit to begin with.  The fruit looked so bad I was afraid to eat any of it.  The counter person seemed OK when we ordered, but she later had a terrible attitude when my friend went up to make a simple request for more napkins.  I will definitely never try this location again!
author: Tim D.

description: Just moved to the area and wanted to get some Sunday brunch. As I was too hungry to brave the line at Boogaloos, we decided to try this place. The space is pretty big and was relatively empty - scattered tables of people each enjoying tasty treats. I had a strawberry nutella crepe with a side of bacon. I MUST have my salt to go with my sweet. The crepe was yummy, decent. I have to say I was a big fan of the bacon because they cooked it in such a way that the gross, chewy fatty part wasn't on my strips. Yay, I hate that part. I also had a Vanilla Bean tea. It was a tea bag, but still delicious. I didn't catch the brand, but was a decent tea. Will definitely come back.
author: Jen T.

description: these people have cooks who know what they are doing. The whole menu, all the food, is awesome. Not your average san francisco crepe, not french like either. Just incredibly delicious. Portions are just right, everybody is super friendly, unbelievably low priced Fat Tire, and totally comfy atmosphere with wifi. What more could any one want?
author: stephen d.

description:
Service:
They're nice about indecision and willing to advise and help you make up your mind.

Ambiance:
Warm, although that might have been the 93 degree weather. We get it so rarely in SF that it seems to color everything when we do.

Like the outdoor seating, but be sure to nab a table when you arrive.

Accessibility:
If you know where to park (on side streets right off Valencia or parallel to it in the two hour zones).

Product:
Huge portions. That might be the best thing I can say about the place. 

The food itself was... a little forgettable. Or maybe the sheer quantity is a turn-off after you plow through half of it. 

The first time I got a Mexican salad with chicken. It was your average romaine based salad. The rest: peppers, beans, tortilla strips, avocado, corn... made the salad. My friend got crepes and appeared to enjoy them heartily.

The second time I got the Asian salad with grilled chicken. Chicken was very tender and tasty, and the noodles were great. They were soft, not crispy, which was unexpected, but still good. This time another friend got an omelette--looked good.

This is definitely a place to go and share a dish. 

Price:
Not cheap, not expensive. Just right for SF, especially considering the portions.
author: Simone E.

description: This is a pretty new place so I had to try it out.  I had one of their specials which was the steak and eggs crepe and it was very good.  I'm planning on trying their sweet crepes next.
author: Ricky M.

description: I doubt these guys will pose a threat to my beloved Ti Couz, but they're pretty good. "The Sopranos" crepe with sausage, egg, olives, spinach, and cheese is probably the heartiest crepe I've ever had. Add to that a basic but nice side salad and some delicious potatoes and you've got a pretty nice meal.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Great place. Large menu of crepes, omelets, eggs, sandwiches and salads. Order at the counter and sit inside or out if it's a nice day.
author: Justin L.

description: I've been to the one in Nob Hill, and I think this one is better. The atmosphere and decor are undeniably more homey and comfortable. My fresh orange juice was a little too tangy, which maybe isn't their fault since oranges aren't really in season during Jan. The Savory eggplant and roasted pepper crepe sounded amazing on paper, but it was much too cheesy. The potatoes that accompanied it were best eaten with a massive hang over. But 3 stars for service, peaceful atmosphere, and nice view of Valencia on a sunny day
author: Esperanza A.

description:
3.5 stars

love the decor and the so many varied kinds of dishes they offer! makes for a fun time! filling and tasty, fast and color, this place is a great place to come to for crepes.

the portion size is big, but the prices are pretty reasonable. service was nice.
author: Catherine Y.

description:
$2.50 microbrew pints pretty much sold me.  Then there is a menu full of crepes and sandwiches to boot.
