I've had the Blintz crepe is very sweet and delicious. I was pleasantly surprised by the chicken pesto crepe, lots of cheese and chicken, with some tomatoes, great stuff.

Ambiance is friendly.  the Cole st location is great as well.
author: Chris E.

description: $2.50 beers keep me and the homies in here on a REGULAR basis...and by regular I mean every other day. It's nice to sit and watch all the hipbags that walk by on Valencia while noshing on a so-so crepe, decent hamburger or acceptable salads. Nothing to write home about besides the beer prices. Since we frequent it so often, the staff and manager take real good care of us. Gotta love that!
author: Alah R.

description: I love crepes.  There  I said it.  I've tried the Crepe House's other locations in Russian Hill and Inner Sunset and have been at 2x a week to their new Mission location.  The staff is awesome, friendly and always say hi and bye (which is not a guarantee in hipsterfrisco).  I always get the same thing: Chicken Pesto Crepe.  The potato's are made with love and the crepes can vary but is usually fresh, plump and filling.  The space is phat ya'll and it beats waiting 30 mins at bugaloo's across the street.  Free WiFi and outlets galore are 'snice.
author: Naeem N.

description: I came here with my friend Troy as he suggested it. I don't eat red meat often even though I should more now as I'm hitting it hard at the gym. I had a burger with fries and it was very good. I'd definitely go again.
author: Joe V.

description: This used to be my go to breakfast/lunch spot in the Mission. Seriously, my friends used to tease me all the time but when you find that mix of budget friendly breakfast and coffee it has to be a staple. Too bad the last 3 times I've gone there I've been thoroughly disappointed. Once I ordered a mimosa only to discover that the orange juice had gone bad, really bad, which seriously killed my taste buds and appetite and the food portions were significantly smaller and more bland in flavor. The last time I went the coffee was old and the house potatoes were no longer thick cubes of garlic yumminess but instead thin slices of slightly burned crisps. Also my boyfriends over easy eggs came out fully cooked. Sad to say I'll be taking this off my list of go to places in SF.
author: Gina D.

description: $2.50 beer on tap..rad!  Huevos ranchero was awesome and vegetarian options taste pretty good.  They make a good soy latte and plenty of seating inside and out.  Nice alternative to my beloved boogaloos.  They take amex too!!
author: K W.

description:
Food is just OK. and EXPENSIVE...you will pay minimum of $10 for a plate and one cup of coffee. 
Other Crepe houses, serve coffee as you're sitting down, this one, doesn't. 

Also, the Crepes need more salt or something, they are just Bland. 
The good thing is the Wi-Fi.

THE BEST CREPE HOUSE IS on Polk. At first I thought they were they same people as this one, if they are, well they need to get the same cook. 
Expensive for the kind of food. Bland..bland..bland...
author: Geena T.

description: I absolutely looooooove their Crepes!! They are the best in SF for sure. Although, they have a tendency of getting my order mixed up a lot. Reason why I had to take down a star. Other than that, great food!
author: Vienna M.

description: its great for a quick bite, and the manager fadi is very friendly
author: Nate K.

description:
All of these crepe places are the same.  A seemingly exciting menu with sub-par and overpriced food.  
I had the Hawaiian, which had some very funky, plastic sweet sauce.  Ekk.

Not sure why I even came to this place... The stars are for the fact that they serve pretty darn cheap draught beer.
author: J E.

description: Every time I come to sf I go to the crepe house. This one is awesome. Great space and I love the communal table. The taps are a great touch.
author: Vin K.

description: came to this place for lunch with a friend recently and it was perfect for two girlfriend's wanting to catch up, but it would have been just as good if i had my boys with me too. kinda gives you that homey but hip feel. food was great, very reasonable prices, extensive menu and staff was accomdating to any slight changes on orders. we had savory crepes this visit and we're too full to try the sweet crepes.Will defiitely be back for moreGreat flavors! water on tap with lemon slices are a nice plus too!
author: heather z.

description: always good  ,fast and pleasant service , food is great and the prices for the area are even better , everyone that works there makes you feel at home,this is the place to go on valencia .
author: NAEL K.

description: Rip-off, rip-off, rip-off.  I'm not going to say the food is bad.  It's OK.  But when a chicken sandwich comes out to over 10 bucks with tax and tip, I want some chicken in it.  In the one I got tonight, the chicken probably could've spared that amount of flesh and walked away.  After I ate here, I had to go home and have dinner.  I should have realized when the place was mostly empty Saturday evening that it was a bad sign.  It's going to be empty of me from now on.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
The place is very pretty, there's no line to order, the food looks amazing, but when it came to the experience, I was expecting a lot more.
My bf ordered a delicious looking plate I tasted and the pancakes were half cooked, the sausages tasted weird, and I ordered this promising crepe that actually tasted delicious, except that they charged my bf extra for ice cream even though it says it comes with it, and both portions of food are very small, my bf and I were very disappointed when we left, we had to go home and eat again... 
I mean, its a nice place where beer seems cheap, but is not a place to have that claimed "brunch or lunch" thing... is more like a snack spot to hang out and pay overpriced breakfast... might as well go to dennis or cross over to the corner on the left and pay the same price for a bigger plate and mega delicious breakfast.
I tried various other crepe places in the city, and trust me, you can get much more for the same.
Oh, and the strawberry crepe you see in the picture, nope, mine definitely didnt look like that and only had one scoop of ice cream
author: Christina L.

description: My husband and I stopped by this morning for breakfast and were pleasantly surprised when we walked in.  This restaurant's owner has taken the time to design and decorate the place quite nicely, and has a professional looking menu posted on the wall above the ordering station.  Though a clearly inexperienced worker took our order, management smartly paired her with an experienced coffee drink maker - so the process went smoothly.  I received my special order Salmon crepe promptly.  My husband received his Eggs Benedict with the requested extra dark English muffin too.  The salad was dressed with a good amount of dressing - very tasty - and the potatoes were crispy.  Coffee was not the greatest though.  There is outdoor seating too, should you want to dine with your pup.  I hope word gets around quickly for these guys.  You should check it out.  It's actually kind of upscale and unexpected for the Valencia corridor.
author: Bobbi C.

description: Decent enough place, but your main butchie cashier has got to go.  She never smiles, is never friendly, never reciprocates discussion... if you don't like dealing with customers, then leave.  You are representing the company and the product.  It's your responsibility to put on a happy face and greet the customers warmly with graciousness and appreciation.  You should be thankful that we go to your business and keep you employed.  Also, don't re-serve yesterdays potatoes.  You may be fooled by it, but we're not.  Dry stale overcooked potatoes just don't do it.  I hate to say -- because of those 2 reasons -- I will not be going back.
author: Customer X.

description: Okay, it's a chain, maybe we'd like it more if grandma and grandpa were owners and cooks, but it's perfectly fine.  Sunday morning, crowded, long line, when we're close to ordering one of the staff asks how many in our party sets us up with table.  Went up to get refill of my decaf and it was out. Woman behind counter tells me it'll be a few, she'll bring it over when ready and indeed shows up with it a few minutes later.  Guy bringing out our food is very pleasant.  At one point after he'd dropped off the food he was walking by, smiles and gives us a thumbs up with a questioning look on his face.  Yup, thumbs up back at ya, all good.
author: Jim K.

description: I live in the neighborhood so I've been in here 3 times and each has been the same experience. Mediocre to good food, but the service is definitely 2 stars. I felt like the person behind the cashier could care less about my business-no smile, no thank you, just a blank stare. This happened for each of the 3 times. Also, the music in there is HORRIBLE. Myself & dining companions noticed this each time. I wish they would just make everyone happy and put on some light jazz. I like the space there, it's kid-friendly but not crawling with kids, and the outside seats are nice.  Food portions are way to much, I wish they would lower the prices a buck or 2 and give us less food.
author: M C.

description: Place was spacious, comfortable, nicely situated and the food was delicious.  Lovely place.  The people were also immensely sweet and attentive.
author: Althea E.

description: stopped by after my yoga class, I guess on the first or second day this place was opened. I've known their menu from the other 2locations but this one has a delicious steak tacos - light, feeling and healthy! the ambiance is also really cool, very high ceilings, comfy chairs, large windows, beautiful walls in the inside. not a high end place but definitely one of my favorite casual brunch-lunch places to go! by the way, this location is very baby-kid friendly , so spacious!
author: sofia b.

description: alpine lodge inspired building with mediterranean inspired menu. another crepe place with the familiar scrawled chalkboard menu. $2.50 beer.
author: Sophia L.
